<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the WordPress admin panel. -->
<!-- 3. Install the "WordPress" importer from the list. -->

		<title>background_pattern_large.jpg</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/?attachment_id=23</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 19 Oct 2011 03:37:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>

		<title>ARaGt</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/?attachment_id=92</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 19 Oct 2011 07:57:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>92</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-10-19 07:57:39</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-10-19 07:57:39</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_context</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[custom-header]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_is_custom_header</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[twentyten]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>

		<title>Download Winter 2012 Schedule</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/gss-schedule-february-2012-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Jan 2012 21:00:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>greenstreetstudios</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/GSS-Schedule-February-2012.pdf</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>2012 GSS Gala</title>

	<item>
		<title>Across the Ages</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/performances-events/across-the-ages/top/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Apr 2012 18:48:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>greenstreetstudios</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/top.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1621</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-04-11 18:48:53</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-04-11 18:48:53</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>closed</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>top</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>1620</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url>http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/top.jpg</wp:attachment_url>

		<title>Learning to Move.sm</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/performances-events/2012-gala/learning-to-move-sm/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 May 2012 03:48:55 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2049</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-05-09 03:48:55</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-05-09 03:48:55</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>closed</wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>Click here for flier!</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/gala-video-showing/june-17th-event/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 10 Jun 2012 21:38:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>greenstreetstudios</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/june-17th-event.pdf</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/924/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=924</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is located at 185 Green St., Cambridge, MA in the heart of the Boston dance community in Central Square. The studio is easily accessible by public transportation: we are located 1 block from buses and the Red Line Central Square T stop. Parking is available in the Green Street Garage and at metered parking lots. Our studios are housed in a two story brick building between Pearl St. and Brookline St. Head up the stairs to visit us & our neighbors Boston Percussive Dance!  Directions by Car Parking Directions by Public Transportation Photo Credit: Liza Voll View Larger Map By Car: From Boston Cross the Massachusetts Avenue Bridge into Cambridge. Half a mile from the bridge turn left on Sidney Street (a wide street just before a fire station on the left) and immediately turn right into Green Street. Drive one block to Brookline Street. Cross Brookline Street. Green Street Studio will be the 2nd building on the right. From Mass Turnpike, Brookline Take Cambridge/Allston exit on to River Street Bridge into Cambridge, continue straight on River Street less than half a mile and make a right turn on Franklin Street. Take the 3rd left turn]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Jimena Bermejo Kieran Jordan Abbie Katz Annie Kloppenberg Toni Matsu David Parker Birute Regine Marcus Schulkind Donna Wabrek    Jimena Bermejo Jimena Bermejo was born in Mexico City holds an MFA in Studio for Interrelated Media from The Massachusetts College of Art and Design and BFA in Dance from The Boston Conservatory. Jimena has performed with Spencer/Colton, Marcus Schulkind, Kate Digby, Ego Art Inc., Kelli Edwards, Lorraine Chapman The Company, Caitlin Corbett Dance Company, Sarah Slifer and as a guest dancer with David Parker and The Bang Group. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces, Jimena is a dance professor at The College of The Holy Cross and Suffolk University.  Abbie H. Katz Abbie H. Katz was Associate Producer for the Boston Early Music Festival from 2002-07; previous to that she was General Manager of The Market Theater in Cambridge. Ms. Katz was also Associate Producer for the Festival of Arts & Ideas in New Haven and General Manager for Anna Deveare Smiths Institute on the Arts and Civic Dialogue at Harvard University. She toured extensively throughout the US, Europe]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Director of Operations Kathryn Dunkel Scheduling Coordinator Sarah Mae Gibbons Treasurer Donna Wabrek Billing Coordinator Toni Matsu Technical Director Erik Fox **Website photos by Liza Voll   Kathryn Dunkel Kathryn Dunkel earned her BA in Dance from Hamilton College with a Minor in Anthropology and is a graduate of the Trinity/La Mama Performance Art program out of New York City. Katie currently dances for Ego Art, Inc. and Falling Flight Project, and has had the pleasure of performing work by choreographers and companies including: Audra Carabetta, Lorraine Chapman, Contrapose Dance, Meghan McLyman, Mariah Steele, Danny Swain Dance Company, and WeberDance. An alumna of the Shared Choreographers Concert (2007) at The Dance Complex & the Emerging Artists Program (2009) at Green Street Studios, Katie has presented her own choreography in Cambridge, MA and New York City. She has taught dance at schools in New York, Vermont, Connecticut, and Massachusetts, and was the Director of Dance at Burr & Burton Academy in Manchester, VT. Most recently, Katie has taught in the Boston area at Wilmington Dance Academy and Green Street Studios and currently teaches dance at Dancers Workshop in Sudbury and Ballet Arts Center of Winchester. Katie also holds her 200-hour]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/934/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=934</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Resident Artists Green Street Studios is home to some of Bostons most engaging and experienced movement artists. Our founding and long time artistic residents engage students on many levels, offering work in classical and innovative movement approaches to contemporary dance. Cheri Opperman is a Founding Director of Green Street Studios in Cambridge where she currently teaches intermediate modern technique. Cheri has been performing, teaching and choreographing professionally for more than 20 years since receiving her BFA in Dance from the Boston Conservatory. As a member of Susan Roses DanceWorks she taught and performed extensively throughout New York and New England and guest taught at the Festival dArles, France.At DanceWorks studio she taught elementary through advanced level of modern technique and repertory. As a member of Concert Dance Company she performed in the works of Merce Cunningham, Mark Morris, Kei Ta Kei, Laura Dean, Lucinda Childs, Bebe Miller, Deborah Wolfe, Mark Dendy and many others, and taught company repertory and master classes on tour including the Colorado Dance Festival. Cheri taught at CDCs School for Contemporary Dance modern and ballet technique, stretch and alignment and company repertory. Her work has been performed at Green Street Studios, The Dance Complex and Emerson]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/936/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=936</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios has the following rooms available for your use: Studio #1 Black fully sprung floor with full length mirrors along one wall and a skylight. 2,500 square feet, ( 40 X 60 ). This studio also functions as a performance space, Studio #2 Black fully sprung floor with full length mirrors along one wall and a skylight. 1,500 square foot, ( 35 X 40 ) General Our facilities also include a dressing room and three bathrooms. If you are a dancer/teacher and are interested in renting space in our studios for rehearsing, teaching classes or workshops, or performing, please email all requests to scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org or leave a voicemail in the Space Rental Requests mailbox, only. We will do our best to respond to all requests within 36-48 hours. If you would like your class, workshop, or performance listed on our web site, please e-mail us with all available information. Please be specific about the date, time, and description of the event for the best turnout. PLEASE NOTE: because of the marley flooring, NO STREET SHOES OR HIGH HEELS are allowed in the studios. For more information, please visit our Rental Information page.]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios thrives upon the help and support of our volunteers. There are many ways to get involved in your local dance community through GSS. Please contact us at 617-864-3191 if you are interested in volunteering, and be sure to check out our site to see what opportunities are available. Green Street Studios seeks: Events Coordinator Volunteer Coordinator For more information or to apply for any of these positions, please email a cover letter, a resume, and at least 1 reference to info@greenstreetstudios.org or mail materials by July 1st to: Green Street Street Studios 185 Green Street Cambridge, MA 02139  Events Coordinator Qualifications: Candidates must demonstrate a genuine interest in Production/Stage Management in a non-profit arts environment. Must be self-motivated, responsible, efficient at multitasking, punctual, responsive, and have excellent customer service skills. Must be organized and efficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PayPal. Experience with Production/Stage Management is preferred. Responsibilities include: Communicating with the renters and the Technical Director Communicating with the GSS staff/scheduling coordinator Recruiting volunteers for events (this includes: ushers, cleaners, box office, tech, set up/break down) Creating and distributing contracts Coordinating other events including but not limited to informal showings, master class, workshops. Availability for]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Yes! I want to be a Member! Green Street Studios depends on the generosity of its community. If you would like to support our work, please stop by the studio and pick up a membership form (located on the bulletin board at the top of the stairs just outside of Studio 1),download a pdf version, or call the office at 617-864-3191. Member Benefits Include: A bimonthly email newsletter about Green Street plans Advance notice of all special Green Street events A members discount at all GSS-produced performances A members reception to meet each other, the GSS staff and GSS artists For the artist membership fee, you will receive all of the above, in addition to discounted rehearsal space Monday-Friday at the Studios, and a one-time use of the Studios mailing list. ]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As a center for developing emerging dance and movement artists, GSS will provide an environment where they can experiment, take artistic risks, perform and grow. GSS will collaborate with the Boston dance community and will bring artists, dancers and Bostons audiences together to share the best and most challenging ideas, practices and practitioners by providing master classes and workshops with guest artists, offering artist residencies, and presenting performances of current and evolving trends. Check out Green Streets Emerging Artists Program! Echoes Emerging Artists Performance July 8 & 9, 2011 8pm Green Street Studios]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/946/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=946</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that enables artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressive capacity of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to explore and establish connections of their own to the traditions and commitments of disciplined movement.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>946</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-01-23 11:30:46</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2012-01-23 11:30:46</wp:post_date_gmt>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/947/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=947</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a 501(c)3 non-profit  Mission Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that enables artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressive capacity of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to explore and establish connections of their own to the traditions and commitments of disciplined movement. Vision Green Street Studios is a dance and movement arts center that serves all ages and skill levels. GSS will develop dance audiences and serve its diverse community by expanding opportunities to experience the magic and wonder of dance and movement. We will be recognized for our artistic integrity, the quality of our dance education and our progressive programming. GSS will strive to identify and fill voids in the dance and movement community that are in harmony with our mission. The best professionals will be working for GSS. They will be experienced, dedicated to continually improving their teaching technique, recognized by the dance and movement community for their work, and committed to fostering and developing the Green Street Studios community.]]></content:encoded>

		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/949/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=949</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Jimena Bermejo Kieran Jordan Abbie Katz Annie Kloppenberg Toni Matsu David Parker Birute Regine Marcus Schulkind Donna Wabrek Jimena Bermejo Jimena Bermejo was born in Mexico City holds an MFA in Studio for Interrelated Media from The Massachusetts College of Art and Design and BFA in Dance from The Boston Conservatory. Jimena has performed with Spencer/Colton, Marcus Schulkind, Kate Digby, Ego Art Inc., Kelli Edwards, Lorraine Chapman The Company, Caitlin Corbett Dance Company, Sarah Slifer and as a guest dancer with David Parker and The Bang Group. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces, Jimena is a dance professor at The College of The Holy Cross and Suffolk University. Kieran Jordan Kieran Jordan is a performer, teacher, and choreographer of Irish dance, and co-founder/director of Boston Percussive Dance. With more than 30 years of experience in Irish dance, Kierans unique approach marries deep-rooted traditions with contemporary innovations. She has collaborated with many of New Englands finest traditional musicians, and has toured as a solo dancer and presented her choreography throughout North America and Europe. Kieran has been teaching in the Boston area since]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/950/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=950</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ Green Street Studios is located at 185 Green St., Cambridge, MA. View Larger Map By Car: From Boston Cross the Massachusetts Avenue Bridge into Cambridge. Half a mile from the bridge turn left on Sidney Street (a wide street just before a fire station on the left) and immediately turn right into Green Street. Drive one block to Brookline Street. Cross Brookline Street. Green Street Studio will be the 2nd building on the right. For parking look for 2 hour meters (free after 6:00 PM and on Sundays) on Brookline Street before crossing it or continue on Green Street to the Municipal parking lot on the left after the stop sign. Meters also available on Massachusetts Avenue (2 and 1 hour meters). From Mass Turnpike, Brookline Take Cambridge/Allston exit on to River Street Bridge into Cambridge, continue straight on River Street less than half a mile and make a right turn on Franklin Street. Take the 3rd left turn onto Brookline Street and the next left onto Green Street. Parking A reasonably priced parking garage is located on Green Street, the next block after Green Street Studios, on the left side of the street. By Public Transportation: To Central]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/955/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=955</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios (GSS) is a laboratory for dance in the Boston area. Founded in 1991 by five artists as a workspace, GSS now supports the performing, rehearsing and teaching needs of a diverse group of individuals and companies. With two studios and 125-seat black box studio/theatre, GSS is a purpose-built dance facility in a dynamic urban setting, one that offers dancers what they need to be successful. Initially, the founders taught Modern Dance and Ballet to pay rent; their success made GSS a vital node in the Boston movement arts community. Over time, teachers of other dance forms joined them. GSS is now home to hundreds of dancers who rehearse and study, and over 20 teachers in a range of disciplines. In 2001 the initial 10-year lease on the space expired. By that time, Central Square, Cambridge, had become a recognized destination, and rent for 2002 represented a 42% increase over the previous year. Renewing the lease and recognizing a new financial landscape pushed the organization to explore its potential and clarify its mission. GSS began evolving from an artist-run cooperative into a fully staffed center for the education and performance of dance and movement arts. Much of the]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>955</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/956/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=956</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that enables artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressive capacity of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to explore and establish connections of their own to the traditions and commitments of disciplined movement.  Green Street Studios is also home to Boston Percussive Dance, an independent studio founded by tap dancer Julia Boynton and Irish step dancer Kieran Jordan, based in Studio #3 at Green Street. Boston Percussive Dance offers classes in tap, Irish step dancing and flamenco for all skill levels. For more information on Boston Percussive classes, performances, events or use of their studio, check out their website at: www.bostonpercussivedance.com]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/960/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=960</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios (GSS) is a laboratory for dance in the Boston area. Founded in 1991 by five artists as a workspace, GSS now supports the performing, rehearsing and teaching needs of a diverse group of individuals and companies. With two studios and 125-seat black box studio/theatre, GSS is a purpose-built dance facility in a dynamic urban setting, one that offers dancers what they need to be successful. The Studio has grown from a cooperatively-run space to a dance and movement arts center managed by an active board of Trustees, a professional staff and volunteers committed to providing affordable facilities for training, rehearsals, and performances. GSS is now home to hundreds of dancers who rehearse and study, and over 20 teachers in a range of disciplines. Green Street Studios is the home of Boston Percussive Dance.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/961/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=961</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization Mission Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that provides a place for artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressiveness of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to be connected to and with the traditions, techniques, and language of dance. Vision Green Street Studios is a dance and movement arts center that serves all ages and skill levels. We will be recognized for our artistic integrity, the quality of our dance education and our progressive programming. GSS will strive to identify and fill voids in the dance and movement community that are in harmony with our mission. The best professionals will be working for GSS. They will be experienced, dedicated to continually improving their teaching technique, recognized by the dance and movement community for their work, and committed to fostering and developing the Green Street Studios community. As a center for developing emerging dance and movement artists, GSS will provide an environment where they can experiment, take artistic risks, perform and]]></content:encoded>

For information on Boston Percussive classes, performances or festivals, check out their website at: www.bostonpercussivedance.com]]></content:encoded>

		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/963/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=963</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is located at 185 Green St., Cambridge, MA in the heart of the Boston dance community in Central Square. The studio is easily accessible by public transportation: we are located 1 block from buses and the Red Line Central Square T stop. Parking is available in the Green Street Garage and at metered parking lots. Our studios are housed in a two story brick building between Pearl St. and Brookline St. Head up the stairs to visit us & our neighbors Boston Percussive Dance!  Directions by Car Parking Directions by Public Transportation Photo Credit: Liza Voll View Larger Map By Car: From Boston Cross the Massachusetts Avenue Bridge into Cambridge. Half a mile from the bridge turn left on Sidney Street (a wide street just before a fire station on the left) and immediately turn right into Green Street. Drive one block to Brookline Street. Cross Brookline Street. Green Street Studio will be the 2nd building on the right. From Mass Turnpike, Brookline Take Cambridge/Allston exit on to River Street Bridge into Cambridge, continue straight on River Street less than half a mile and make a right turn on Franklin Street. Take the 3rd left turn]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Jimena Bermejo Kieran Jordan Abbie Katz Annie Kloppenberg Toni Matsu David Parker Birute Regine Marcus Schulkind Donna Wabrek    Jimena Bermejo Jimena Bermejo was born in Mexico City holds an MFA in Studio for Interrelated Media from The Massachusetts College of Art and Design and BFA in Dance from The Boston Conservatory. Jimena has performed with Spencer/Colton, Marcus Schulkind, Kate Digby, Ego Art Inc., Kelli Edwards, Lorraine Chapman The Company, Caitlin Corbett Dance Company, Sarah Slifer and as a guest dancer with David Parker and The Bang Group. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces, Jimena is a dance professor at The College of The Holy Cross and Suffolk University.  Abbie H. Katz Abbie H. Katz was Associate Producer for the Boston Early Music Festival from 2002-07; previous to that she was General Manager of The Market Theater in Cambridge. Ms. Katz was also Associate Producer for the Festival of Arts & Ideas in New Haven and General Manager for Anna Deveare Smiths Institute on the Arts and Civic Dialogue at Harvard University. She toured extensively throughout the US, Europe]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Director of Operations Kathryn Dunkel Scheduling Coordinator Sarah Mae Gibbons Treasurer Donna Wabrek Billing Coordinator Toni Matsu Technical Director Erik Fox **Website photos by Liza Voll   Kathryn Dunkel Kathryn Dunkel earned her BA in Dance from Hamilton College with a Minor in Anthropology and is a graduate of the Trinity/La Mama Performance Art program out of New York City. Katie currently dances for Ego Art, Inc. and Falling Flight Project, and has had the pleasure of performing work by choreographers and companies including: Audra Carabetta, Lorraine Chapman, Contrapose Dance, Meghan McLyman, Mariah Steele, Danny Swain Dance Company, and WeberDance. An alumna of the Shared Choreographers Concert (2007) at The Dance Complex & the Emerging Artists Program (2009) at Green Street Studios, Katie has presented her own choreography in Cambridge, MA and New York City. She has taught dance at schools in New York, Vermont, Connecticut, and Massachusetts, and was the Director of Dance at Burr & Burton Academy in Manchester, VT. Most recently, Katie has taught in the Boston area at Wilmington Dance Academy and Green Street Studios and currently teaches dance at Dancers Workshop in Sudbury and Ballet Arts Center of Winchester. Katie also holds her 200-hour]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/974/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=974</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Resident Artists Green Street Studios is home to some of Bostons most engaging and experienced movement artists. Our founding and long time artistic residents engage students on many levels, offering work in classical and innovative movement approaches to contemporary dance. Cheri Opperman is a Founding Director of Green Street Studios in Cambridge where she currently teaches intermediate modern technique. Cheri has been performing, teaching and choreographing professionally for more than 20 years since receiving her BFA in Dance from the Boston Conservatory. As a member of Susan Roses DanceWorks she taught and performed extensively throughout New York and New England and guest taught at the Festival dArles, France.At DanceWorks studio she taught elementary through advanced level of modern technique and repertory. As a member of Concert Dance Company she performed in the works of Merce Cunningham, Mark Morris, Kei Ta Kei, Laura Dean, Lucinda Childs, Bebe Miller, Deborah Wolfe, Mark Dendy and many others, and taught company repertory and master classes on tour including the Colorado Dance Festival. Cheri taught at CDCs School for Contemporary Dance modern and ballet technique, stretch and alignment and company repertory. Her work has been performed at Green Street Studios, The Dance Complex and Emerson]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios has the following rooms available for your use: Studio #1 Black fully sprung floor with full length mirrors along one wall and a skylight. 2,500 square feet, ( 40 X 60 ). This studio also functions as a performance space, Studio #2 Black fully sprung floor with full length mirrors along one wall and a skylight. 1,500 square foot, ( 35 X 40 ) General Our facilities also include a dressing room and three bathrooms. If you are a dancer/teacher and are interested in renting space in our studios for rehearsing, teaching classes or workshops, or performing, please email all requests to scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org or leave a voicemail in the Space Rental Requests mailbox, only. We will do our best to respond to all requests within 36-48 hours. If you would like your class, workshop, or performance listed on our web site, please e-mail us with all available information. Please be specific about the date, time, and description of the event for the best turnout. PLEASE NOTE: because of the marley flooring, NO STREET SHOES OR HIGH HEELS are allowed in the studios. For more information, please visit our Rental Information page.]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios thrives upon the help and support of our volunteers. There are many ways to get involved in your local dance community through GSS. Please contact us at 617-864-3191 if you are interested in volunteering, and be sure to check out our site to see what opportunities are available. Green Street Studios seeks: Events Coordinator Volunteer Coordinator For more information or to apply for any of these positions, please email a cover letter, a resume, and at least 1 reference to info@greenstreetstudios.org or mail materials by July 1st to: Green Street Street Studios 185 Green Street Cambridge, MA 02139  Events Coordinator Qualifications: Candidates must demonstrate a genuine interest in Production/Stage Management in a non-profit arts environment. Must be self-motivated, responsible, efficient at multitasking, punctual, responsive, and have excellent customer service skills. Must be organized and efficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PayPal. Experience with Production/Stage Management is preferred. Responsibilities include: Communicating with the renters and the Technical Director Communicating with the GSS staff/scheduling coordinator Recruiting volunteers for events (this includes: ushers, cleaners, box office, tech, set up/break down) Creating and distributing contracts Coordinating other events including but not limited to informal showings, master class, workshops. Availability for]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/980/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=980</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Yes! I want to be a Member! Green Street Studios depends on the generosity of its community. If you would like to support our work, please stop by the studio and pick up a membership form (located on the bulletin board at the top of the stairs just outside of Studio 1),download a pdf version, or call the office at 617-864-3191. Member Benefits Include: A bimonthly email newsletter about Green Street plans Advance notice of all special Green Street events A members discount at all GSS-produced performances A members reception to meet each other, the GSS staff and GSS artists For the artist membership fee, you will receive all of the above, in addition to discounted rehearsal space Monday-Friday at the Studios, and a one-time use of the Studios mailing list. ]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/983/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=983</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As a center for developing emerging dance and movement artists, GSS will provide an environment where they can experiment, take artistic risks, perform and grow. GSS will collaborate with the Boston dance community and will bring artists, dancers and Bostons audiences together to share the best and most challenging ideas, practices and practitioners by providing master classes and workshops with guest artists, offering artist residencies, and presenting performances of current and evolving trends. Check out Green Streets Emerging Artists Program! Echoes Emerging Artists Performance July 8 & 9, 2011 8pm Green Street Studios]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/987/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=987</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a 501(c)3 non-profit  Mission Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that enables artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressive capacity of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to explore and establish connections of their own to the traditions and commitments of disciplined movement. Vision Green Street Studios is a dance and movement arts center that serves all ages and skill levels. GSS will develop dance audiences and serve its diverse community by expanding opportunities to experience the magic and wonder of dance and movement. We will be recognized for our artistic integrity, the quality of our dance education and our progressive programming. GSS will strive to identify and fill voids in the dance and movement community that are in harmony with our mission. The best professionals will be working for GSS. They will be experienced, dedicated to continually improving their teaching technique, recognized by the dance and movement community for their work, and committed to fostering and developing the Green Street Studios community.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/989/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=989</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Jimena Bermejo Kieran Jordan Abbie Katz Annie Kloppenberg Toni Matsu David Parker Birute Regine Marcus Schulkind Donna Wabrek Jimena Bermejo Jimena Bermejo was born in Mexico City holds an MFA in Studio for Interrelated Media from The Massachusetts College of Art and Design and BFA in Dance from The Boston Conservatory. Jimena has performed with Spencer/Colton, Marcus Schulkind, Kate Digby, Ego Art Inc., Kelli Edwards, Lorraine Chapman The Company, Caitlin Corbett Dance Company, Sarah Slifer and as a guest dancer with David Parker and The Bang Group. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces, Jimena is a dance professor at The College of The Holy Cross and Suffolk University. Kieran Jordan Kieran Jordan is a performer, teacher, and choreographer of Irish dance, and co-founder/director of Boston Percussive Dance. With more than 30 years of experience in Irish dance, Kierans unique approach marries deep-rooted traditions with contemporary innovations. She has collaborated with many of New Englands finest traditional musicians, and has toured as a solo dancer and presented her choreography throughout North America and Europe. Kieran has been teaching in the Boston area since]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/990/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=990</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ Green Street Studios is located at 185 Green St., Cambridge, MA. View Larger Map By Car: From Boston Cross the Massachusetts Avenue Bridge into Cambridge. Half a mile from the bridge turn left on Sidney Street (a wide street just before a fire station on the left) and immediately turn right into Green Street. Drive one block to Brookline Street. Cross Brookline Street. Green Street Studio will be the 2nd building on the right. For parking look for 2 hour meters (free after 6:00 PM and on Sundays) on Brookline Street before crossing it or continue on Green Street to the Municipal parking lot on the left after the stop sign. Meters also available on Massachusetts Avenue (2 and 1 hour meters). From Mass Turnpike, Brookline Take Cambridge/Allston exit on to River Street Bridge into Cambridge, continue straight on River Street less than half a mile and make a right turn on Franklin Street. Take the 3rd left turn onto Brookline Street and the next left onto Green Street. Parking A reasonably priced parking garage is located on Green Street, the next block after Green Street Studios, on the left side of the street. By Public Transportation: To Central]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>990</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-01-23 11:30:49</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name>990</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>

		<wp:menu_order>27</wp:menu_order>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/995/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=995</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios (GSS) is a laboratory for dance in the Boston area. Founded in 1991 by five artists as a workspace, GSS now supports the performing, rehearsing and teaching needs of a diverse group of individuals and companies. With two studios and 125-seat black box studio/theatre, GSS is a purpose-built dance facility in a dynamic urban setting, one that offers dancers what they need to be successful. Initially, the founders taught Modern Dance and Ballet to pay rent; their success made GSS a vital node in the Boston movement arts community. Over time, teachers of other dance forms joined them. GSS is now home to hundreds of dancers who rehearse and study, and over 20 teachers in a range of disciplines. In 2001 the initial 10-year lease on the space expired. By that time, Central Square, Cambridge, had become a recognized destination, and rent for 2002 represented a 42% increase over the previous year. Renewing the lease and recognizing a new financial landscape pushed the organization to explore its potential and clarify its mission. GSS began evolving from an artist-run cooperative into a fully staffed center for the education and performance of dance and movement arts. Much of the]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>995</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2012-01-23 11:30:50</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>995</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>47</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>24</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>nav_menu_item</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="nav_menu" nicename="main"><![CDATA[Main]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/996/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=996</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that enables artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressive capacity of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to explore and establish connections of their own to the traditions and commitments of disciplined movement.  Green Street Studios is also home to Boston Percussive Dance, an independent studio founded by tap dancer Julia Boynton and Irish step dancer Kieran Jordan, based in Studio #3 at Green Street. Boston Percussive Dance offers classes in tap, Irish step dancing and flamenco for all skill levels. For more information on Boston Percussive classes, performances, events or use of their studio, check out their website at: www.bostonpercussivedance.com]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/1000/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=1000</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios (GSS) is a laboratory for dance in the Boston area. Founded in 1991 by five artists as a workspace, GSS now supports the performing, rehearsing and teaching needs of a diverse group of individuals and companies. With two studios and 125-seat black box studio/theatre, GSS is a purpose-built dance facility in a dynamic urban setting, one that offers dancers what they need to be successful. The Studio has grown from a cooperatively-run space to a dance and movement arts center managed by an active board of Trustees, a professional staff and volunteers committed to providing affordable facilities for training, rehearsals, and performances. GSS is now home to hundreds of dancers who rehearse and study, and over 20 teachers in a range of disciplines. Green Street Studios is the home of Boston Percussive Dance.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/1001/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 11:30:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?p=1001</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization Mission Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that provides a place for artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressiveness of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to be connected to and with the traditions, techniques, and language of dance. Vision Green Street Studios is a dance and movement arts center that serves all ages and skill levels. We will be recognized for our artistic integrity, the quality of our dance education and our progressive programming. GSS will strive to identify and fill voids in the dance and movement community that are in harmony with our mission. The best professionals will be working for GSS. They will be experienced, dedicated to continually improving their teaching technique, recognized by the dance and movement community for their work, and committed to fostering and developing the Green Street Studios community. As a center for developing emerging dance and movement artists, GSS will provide an environment where they can experiment, take artistic risks, perform and]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Rentals</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/rentals/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 03:57:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=27</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Green Street Studios has the following spaces available </strong>

<strong>for rehearsals, classes, and performances:</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1712" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Studio #1                                     Photo by Liza Voll Photography"]<img class="size-medium wp-image-1712 " title="GSS-by-Liza-Voll-7" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/GSS-by-Liza-Voll-7-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" />[/caption]

&nbsp;

<strong>Studio #1</strong>

&nbsp;

Black fully sprung marley floor with full length mirrors along one wall, windows along one wall, and a skylight. 2,500 square feet, (40 X 60). This studio also functions as a performance space.
<br/>
<a title="Rent Space" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/rentals/rent-space/" target="_blank">RENT Studio #1 for your rehearsal, workshop, or performance</a>
<br/>
Local companies that rehearse at Green Street:

Contrapose Dance,EgoArt, Inc.,Danny McCusker and Dancers,Luminarium Dance,and more...
<br/>
<br/>
<strong>Studio #2</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1713" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Studio #2                                     Photo by Liza Voll Photography"]<img class="size-medium wp-image-1713" title="GSS by Liza Voll-15" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/GSS-by-Liza-Voll-15-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" />[/caption]

<strong></strong>
Grey fully sprung floor with full length mirrors along one wall and a skylight. 1,500 square foot, (35 X 40)
<br/>
<a title="Rent Space" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/rentals/rent-space/" target="_blank">RENT Studio #2 for your rehearsal or workshop</a>
<br/>
*Our facilities also include a dressing room and three bathrooms.*<strong>PLEASE NOTE:</strong>due to the marley flooring,NO STREET SHOES OR HEELED SHOESare allowed in the studios.

<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=176" target="_blank">RentSpace</a>

&nbsp;

If you are a dancer/teacher and are interested in renting space in our studios for rehearsing, teaching classes or workshops, or performing, please email all requests to<a href="mailto:scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org</a>or leave a voicemail in the Space Rental Requests mailbox at 617-864-3191. For more info click <a title="Rent Space" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/rentals/rent-space/" target="_blank">here</a>.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Get Involved</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/get-involved/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 03:59:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=34</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Volunteer with us!</strong>

<em>**GSS seeks enthusiastic and responsible work study students for the Spring/Summer. Cleaning and office shifts may be available; 3 monthcommitmentrequired. Please contact <a href="mailto:info@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">info@greenstreetstudios.org</a> if interested.</em>
<br/>
[caption id="attachment_482" align="alignright" width="199" caption="Photo by Liza Voll Photography"]<img class="size-medium wp-image-482 " title="_DSC1293-11" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/DSC1293-1111-199x300.jpg" alt="" width="199" height="300" />[/caption]

Green Street Studios thrives upon the help and support of our volunteers. There are many ways to get involved in your local dance community through GSS including workstudy in exchange for classes. Please contact us at<strong>617-864-3191</strong>or email
<a href="mailto:info@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">info@greenstreetstudios.org</a> if you are interested in volunteering.
<br/>
Thank you to all of our wonderful past and present volunteers!

&nbsp;

<strong><a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=37" target="_blank">Become a Member!</a></strong>2012 Members receive special ticket rates to events, rehearsal discounts, and more.

&nbsp;

<strong>Donate!</strong>

As a small non-profit, GSS is always looking for donations from our generous supporters. Ifyou'd like to donate money, we'd like to encourage you to become a member or sponsor us. We are always looking for people who can donate their time by volunteering with Green Street Studios. In addition, we are currently looking for the following donations:
<br/>
- Stereo/audio equipment

- New, comfortable folding chairs for the Theatre

- Resources and capital for building an Elevator

- New Carpeting

- Video projector

&nbsp;

Green Street Studios is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Membership</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/get-involved/membership/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 03:59:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=37</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_921" align="alignright" width="199" caption="Photo by Liza Voll Photography"]<img class="size-medium wp-image-527" title="_DSC1350-37" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/DSC1350-371-199x300.jpg" alt="" width="199" height="300" />[/caption]

<strong>Green Street announces our Annual Membership Drive</strong>.

Support your local non-profit by becoming a 2012 Member! Please read our <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/GSS-Membership-Letter-2012.pdf" target="_blank">letter</a> with highlights from our 2011 season and exciting plans for 2012! Any donation amount is welcome.Donate today! Download the<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/11/GSS-Member-Form-20121.pdf" target="_blank">GSS Member Form 2012</a>

&nbsp;

<em>Membership Benefits Include:</em>
- Email Newsletters
- Advance notice of special GSS events
- Members' discount to select performances (plus all GSS produced events)
- Members' discount to GSS sponsored master classes
* Artist Members receive all of the above, plus discounted rehearsal space Monday-Friday from 9-5pm, plus one-time use of our mailing list.

&nbsp;

Membership Tiers:
Student Friend: $35
Friend of Green Street: $50-$99
Production Partner: $100-$499
Sponsor: $500-$9999
Angel: $1000 and up

OR

Artist Member: $150
Artist Members receive a discounted rehearsal rate Monday through Friday from 9-5 and access to our mailing list for your dance even once per year.

&nbsp;

Donate today! Please download the <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/11/GSS-Member-Form-20121.pdf" target="_blank">GSS Member Form 2012</a> and mail it in with your payment to 185 Green Street, Cambridge, MA 02139

&nbsp;

The Green Street Studios is a non-profit organization under the 501(c)(3) ruling. All donations are tax-deductible to the full extent of the law.

Thank you for being part of our community and for your support!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Artist Programs</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/artist-programs/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:00:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=43</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="LEFT"><strong>Emerging Artists Spring/Summer 2012</strong></p>
<p align="LEFT">Jeffrey Gugliotti</p>
<p align="LEFT">Kristen Duffy Young</p>
<p align="LEFT">Caitlin Ewing and Kelly Onder</p>
<p align="LEFT">Lailye Weidman</p>
Mentors: Heidi Henderson, Meghan McLyman (EA Alumna), Micki Taylor-Pinni
<br/>
The artists are at work! Stay tuned for info on their show coming up June 15th and 16th
<br/>
February 27, 2012: Congratulations to Katherine Anderson, Angie Conte, Sarah Mae Gibbons, Chien Hwe, and Kathleen Nasti on a fantastic show this past weekend! A special thanks goes out to mentors Adrienne Hawkins, Annie Kloppenberg, &amp; Kathy Young, Tech Director Erik Fox, and all the wonderful volunteers who made the show possible. Thanks to everyone who came out to support the artists and the show.
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;"><strong>Winter Emerging Artist Performance</strong></span></span></span><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-1269" title="Feb EA poster" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/333107_717329658801_35003606_35491012_344573553_o-235x300.jpg" alt="" width="235" height="300" /></p>
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Feb 24-25, 2012 8pm
$10 BDA/GSS and Students or by Reservation
$15 At The Door</span></span></span></p>
<br/>
<p align="LEFT"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana,Geneva,Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Emerging Artists Winter 2012</span></span></span></span></strong></p>
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Katherine Anderson</span></span></span></p>
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Angela Conte</span></span></span></p>
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Sarah Mae Gibbons</span></span></span></p>
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Chien Hwe Carol Hong</span></span></span></p>
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Kathleen Nasti</span></span></span></p>
&nbsp;
<p align="LEFT"><span style="color: #4f604f;"><span style="font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Mentors: Adrienne Hawkins, Annie Kloppenberg, and Cathy Young.</span></span></span></p>


[caption id="attachment_523" align="aligncenter" width="472" caption="Photo by Liza Voll Photography"]<img class=" wp-image-523  " title="_DSC1348-36" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/DSC1348-361-1024x679.jpg" alt="" width="472" height="312" />[/caption]

<strong>The Emerging Artists Award Program</strong>is designed to provide infrastructure for choreographers, to create new work, and to provide deep, ongoing mentorship between experienced and early-to-mid-career choreographers. The Emerging Artist Award provides the opportunity for New England-based choreographers to be in residence at Green Street Studios. Green Street Studios provides choreographers with Mentor/Choreographers, and 40 hours of rehearsal space per awardee for the creation of new work. The new works by the awardees premiere in a fully produced, shared concert at Green Street Studios.

&nbsp;

Check out Green Street's<a title="Emerging Artists Program" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=177" target="_blank">Past Emerging Artists Programs</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>About Us</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:01:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=47</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that enables artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressive capacity of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to explore and establish connections of their own to the traditions and commitments of disciplined movement.

<img title="LizaVollPhotography-7003" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/LizaVollPhotography-7003-200x300.jpg" alt="" width="200" height="300" /><img title="LizaVollPhotography-6908" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/LizaVollPhotography-6908-199x300.jpg" alt="" width="199" height="300" /><img title="LizaVollPhotography-6937" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/LizaVollPhotography-6937-199x300.jpg" alt="" width="199" height="300" />

Website Photos by<a href="http://www.lizavoll.com/" target="_blank">Liza Voll Photography</a>

<a href="http://ellenfeldman.net/portfolios/dancer/index.html" target="_blank">GSS image by Ellen Feldman</a>

&nbsp;

Green Street Studios is also home to <strong>Boston Percussive Dance</strong>, an independent studio founded by tap dancer Julia Boynton and Irish step dancer Kieran Jordan, based in Studio #3 at Green Street. Boston Percussive Dance offers classes in tap, Irish step dancing and flamenco for all skill levels. For more information on Boston Percussive classes, performances, events or use of their studio, check out their website at: <a title="Boston Percussive Dance" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/boston-percussive-dance/" target="_blank">Boston Percussive Dance</a>
<br/>
Green Street Studios is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization
<br/>
<a title="History" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/history/" target="_blank">History</a>

<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=49" target="_blank">Staff</a>

<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=51" target="_blank">Board</a>

<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=55" target="_blank">Contact Us</a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Staff</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/staff/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:02:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=49</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a name="top"></a>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Director of Operations </strong></span>
<a href="#kathryn"> Kathryn Dunkel Zeek</a>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Scheduling Coordinator</strong></span>
<a href="#sarah"> Sarah Mae Gibbons</a>

<strong>Billing Coordinator</strong>
<a href="#toni">Toni Matsu</a>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Treasurer</strong></span>
<a href="#donna"> Donna Wabrek</a>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Technical Director</strong></span>
<a href="#erik"> Erik Fox</a>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Volunteer Coordiantor</strong></span>
<a href="#donna"> Carolyn Salvi</a>

**Website photos by <a href="http://www.lizavoll.com/" target="_blank">Liza Voll Photography</a>
<a id="kathryn" name="kathryn"></a>
** Thank you to our wonderful staff of work study students!

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #888888;"><span style="color: #888888;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Kathryn Dunkel Zeek</strong></span></span></span>

Kathryn Dunkel earned her BA in Dance from Hamilton College with a Minor in Anthropology and is a graduate of the Trinity/La Mama Performance Art program out of New York City. Katie currently dances for Ego Art, Inc. and Falling Flight Project, and has had the pleasure of performing work by choreographers and companies including: Audra Carabetta, Lorraine Chapman, Contrapose Dance, Meghan McLyman, Mariah Steele, and Danny Swain Dance Company. An alumna of the Shared Choreographers Concert (2007) at The Dance Complex &amp; the Emerging Artists Program (2009) at Green Street Studios, Katie has presented her own choreography in Cambridge, MA and New York City. She has taught dance at schools in New York, Vermont, Connecticut, and Massachusetts, and was the Director of Dance at Burr &amp; Burton Academy in Manchester, VT. Most recently, Katie has taught in the Boston area at Wilmington Dance Academy and Green Street Studios and currently teaches dance at Dancers Workshop in Sudbury and Ballet Arts Center of Winchester. Katie also holds her 200-hour Yoga Teacher Training certification through YogaWorks.
<a id="sarah" name="sarah"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Sarah Mae Gibbons</strong></span>

Sarah Mae Gibbons, originally from Athens, Ohio, earned her BFA in dance and minored in education at The Ohio State University. While there, she performed in works by numerous faculty members including; Bebe Miller, Ming Lung Yang and Victoria Uris as well as independent works by Annie Kloppenberg, Shawn Hove and Foreground Dance. Sarah Maes aesthetic and interests lie in reinvesting attention to the practice of improvisation as a performance form, dance as a means of education and discovering links between choreography and research. Sarah Mae currently dances for Annie Kloppenberg, Deadfall Dance, and other independent choreographers as well as teaching at the Dance Place and for the Cambridge Performance Project. In addition, Sarah Maes choreography has been shown and received recognition at the Ohio Christian Dance Assembly. She is one of the founding members of P.I.E. (Performance Improvisation Ensemble) a touring compositional improvisation community. She is also working in close collaboration with Caitlin Ewing and Kelly Onder in the creation of a new Boston based Dance Company.
<a id="toni" name="toni"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Toni Matsu </strong></span>
Dancer, Gardener, Manager, Reader, Textile Artist. Toni suffers the odd combination of a strong artistic sensibility and an organized, button-down intelligence. Over the years it has led her to the management of a variety of arts and non-profit groups.
<a id="donna" name="donna"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Donna Wabrek </strong></span>
Donna, a graduate of Northeastern University (Accounting) and the University of Lowell (Music Performance), has over 15 years experience working in accounting related positions including office management, staff accountant and controller positions in various for-profit and non-profit organizations. Since Donna came on board as Treasurer at Green Street Studios in 2009, she has been hands-on in managing the finances of our organization. She enjoys the volunteer work, and having a background specifically in music, still shares a passion for all branches of the Arts.
<a id="erik" name="erik"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<strong>Erik Fox</strong>

<strong></strong>Erik Foxearned his BFA in theatrical design and technology from Emerson College in 2007. Outside the studio he works as a freelance lighting designer in and around Boston. Recent local designs include Whistler In the Darks production of<em>Marys Wedding</em>, The Longwood Players production of<em>Lend Me a Tenor</em>, The Nextdoor Theaters production of<em>Nunsense,</em>and the Groton Schools productions of<em>Inherit the Wind, Once On This Island,</em>and<em>A Raisin in the Sun</em>. New York designs include The Movement Workshop Groups productions of<em>Moontides in 23,149 Parts</em>and<em>Wanderlust</em>. Erik is also the lighting designer in residence for Green Street Studios and for the Northshore YMCAs childrens theater program. For more information feel free to visit his website at<a href="http://www.foxyld.com/" target="_blank">www.foxyLD.com</a>

<a id="carolyn" name="carolyn"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Carolyn Salvi </strong></span>
Carolyn Salvi hails originally from Colorado and has been dancing since the age of three. She has trained across the country with many wonderful teachers including Mme. Tatiana Legat, Lorita Travaglia, and Jillana and has performed with Colorado Ballet and the Boston Ballet. Carolyn recently finished her Ph.D in English at Tufts University and is now happily teaching in the Women's Studies program at Suffolk. When not dancing, teaching, thinking about dancing, or helping at Green Street, Carolyn runs a small tutoring business and pursues various research projects in performance studies, gender, and children's literature.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=51" target="_blank">Board Members</a>

For more information Green Street's <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=57" target="_blank">Mission click here</a>

&nbsp;

<a href="#top">back to top</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_name>staff</wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>Board Members</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/board/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:02:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=51</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a name="top"></a>
<a href="#jimena" target="_top"><strong style="text-align: left;">Jimena Bermejo</strong></a>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="#kieran">Kieran Jordan</a></strong></span></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="#annie">Annie Kloppenberg</a></strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="#toni">Toni Matsu</a></strong></span></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><strong><a href="#jennifer">Jennifer Moll</a></strong></strong></span></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="#david"><strong></strong>David Parker</a></strong></span></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="#marcus">Marcus Schulkind</a></strong></span></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="#donna">Donna Wabrek</a></strong></span></span></p>
<a id="jimena" name="jimena"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Jimena Bermejo</strong></span>
Jimena Bermejo was born in Mexico City holds an MFA in Studio for Interrelated Media from The Massachusetts College of Art and Design and BFA in Dance from The Boston Conservatory. Jimena has performed with Spencer/Colton, Marcus Schulkind, Kate Digby, Ego Art Inc., Kelli Edwards, Lorraine Chapman The Company, Caitlin Corbett Dance Company, Sarah Slifer and as a guest dancer with David Parker and The Bang Group. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces. Along with performing Jimena continues to teach, choreograph and create video/performance pieces, Jimena is a dance professor at The College of The Holy Cross and Suffolk University.
<a id="kieran" name="kieran"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<a id="annie" name="annie"></a>
<strong>Kieran Jordan </strong>
Kieran Jordan has been teaching Irish dance in the Boston area since 2001. Her classes were the first of their kind in New England, designed specifically for adults in a non-competitive format, and focused on embodied technique, musicality and performance skills, as well as Irish dance history and community traditions. Kieran is Dance Director for the WGBH production of A Christmas Celtic Sojourn. She has collaborated with many of New Englands finest traditional musicians and is a frequent performer at concerts and festivals all over North America. Winner of a 2008 Artist Fellowship from the Massachusetts Cultural Council, Kieran holds a BA in English and Irish Studies from Boston College, a Masters Degree in Contemporary Dance Performance from the University of Limerick, Ireland, and the TCRG certificate for teaching Irish dance. She has produced two DVDs on Sean-ns (old style) Irish dance  a documentary called Secrets of the Sole and a new instructional video entitled Musical Feet!

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong id="annie">Annie Kloppenberg </strong></span>
Annie Kloppenbergs current creative and theoretical work hinges on improvisation. She teaches and performs nationally with the improvisational ensemble, Like You Mean It, and has given scholarly papers and published work about using improvisation as a choreographic method. Called a choreographer of nuances by the Boston Globe, Annie Kloppenberg &amp; Company, has been supported by notable residency programs and organizations, and, in 2010, returned/relocated to Boston. Annies first association with GSS began in 2002 when her first concert, Caution: Flammable, was presented by GSSs innaugural Emerging Artist Program. Annie has worked in arts administration at Dance Theater Workshop (NYC), New York City Center, The Wexner Center (OH), and The Bates Dance Festival (ME). Annie is Assistant Professor of Dance at Colby College (ME) and holds a BA from Middlebury College (VT) and an MFA from The Ohio State University. More information: <a href="http://www.anniekloppenberg.com/iWeb/Annie%20Kloppenberg/Home.html" target="_blank">www.anniekloppenberg.com</a>, <a href="http://www.lymitrio.com/" target="_blank">www.lymitrio.com</a>
<a id="toni" name="toni"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<strong>Toni Matsu</strong>

Dancer, Gardener, Manager, Reader, Textile Artist. Toni suffers the odd combination of a strong artistic sensibility and an organized, button-down intelligence. Over the years it has led her to the management of a variety of arts and non-profit groups.
<a id="jennifer" name="jennifer"></a>
<a href="#top">back to top</a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<strong>Jennifer Moll</strong>

Jennifer is a life-long dance enthusiast, having begun her studies inballet and finding modern dance later in life. She graduated fromDickinson College, where she was very active in their Dance TheatreGroup, and the University of Cambridge, where she also danced.Jennifer joined the Board in 2011.
<a id="david" name="david"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<strong>David Parker</strong>
David Parker grew up in the Boston area and moved to New York City in 1979. After a decade of wide-ranging performance work in New York's "downtown" dance world during the eighties,<span style="color: #222222;">Parker</span><span style="color: #000000;">began making his own work and, together with Jeffrey Kazin, founded The Bang Group in 1995. His work is driven by a love of rhythmic form and the humor which flows from it. He has worked internationally as a dancer and choreographer and has been commissioned to make over 25 dances for companies other than his own, including that of Lorraine Chapman in Boston. In New York City, his company has been presented in 8 full-evening programs by Dance Theater Workshop and 2 each by Danspace Project, Symphony Space and DanceNow/NYC. The Bang Group has appeared in 13 countries and 21 of the United States. It has been touring</span><span style="color: #222222;">Parker</span><span style="color: #000000;">'s comic/subversive, neo-vaudevillian version of the Nut/Cracker entitled Nut/Cracked for the past eight seasons including three seasons at the Roberts Theater at the Boston Center for the Arts through the Theater Offensive's Out on the Edge Festival. The Bang Group has been in residence at Concord Summer Stages Dance Festival for the past eleven summers and will return this summer with their new dance-theater cabaret show entitled Misters and Sisters. The Bang Group has been the sole dance company in residence at Manhattan's West End Theater where</span><span style="color: #222222;">Parker</span><span style="color: #000000;">and Jeffrey Kazin present triannual choreographic mini-festivals. They have prioritized the presentation of Boston dance artists there and have already included Kate Digby, Kelli Edwards, Lorraine Chapman and Nicole Pierce.</span><span style="color: #222222;">Parker</span><span style="color: #000000;">is on the faculties of the Juilliard School, Barnard College and The Alvin Ailey School teaching Dance Composition at all three. He serves on the boards of Danspace Project, The Field and Green Street Studio. He has been a member of the Bessies Committee, is a regular adjudicator at American College Dance Festival Association, serves frequently on granting and curatorial panels and is a contributing writer to Dance Magazine. He has also recently appeared as a guest performer with Doug Elkins (Fraulein Maria), Sara Rudner (Dancing on View at the ICA), Nicholas Leicher (The Whiz) and Christopher Williams (The Golden Legend). He served as mentor for Green Street's Emerging Choreographers program in 2008 and 2011.</span>

<strong>
</strong> <a id="marcus" name="marcus"></a>

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Marcus Schulkind </strong></span>
Marcus is a founding director of Green Street Studios and has been dancing, teaching, and performing for over thirty-three years. Originally trained in Graham Technique and Graham based variants (Norman Walker, May ODonnell, Pearl Lang), he went on to study ballet with Antony Tudor and Maggie Black at Julliard, bodywork with Zena Rommett (for whom he taught in New York), and Pilates Technique with Kathy Grant. He has performed nationally and internationally with many major modern dance companies including Lar Lubovitch, Kathy Posin, and Batsheva Dance Company of Isreal. He has taught in the United States, Europe, Canada, and the Middle East. Mr. Schulkind is a nationally recognized dancer, teacher, and choreographer, having received grants from the N.E.A., N.Y.S.C.A., Affiliate Artists Inc., Bank Boston Celebrity Series, and First Night. He has choreographed for Dennis Waynes Company, Princeton Ballet, David Brown, Elisa Monte, 5 by 2 Plus, People Dancing, Pick of the Crop, Little Feet, Peanut Butter and Jelly Dance Company, and in Canada for Dance Partout and the National Ballet of Egypt. Since seriously injuring his knee twelve years ago, he has been integrating physical therapies and his five year training of Pilates into his floor barre, modern, and ballet technique classes. Marcus is also a <a href="http://www.marcusschulkind.org/" target="_blank">practicing acupuncturist</a>.
<a id="donna" name="donna"></a>

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Donna Wabrek </strong></span>
Donna, a graduate of Northeastern University (Accounting) and the University of Lowell (Music Performance), has over 15 years experience working in accounting related positions including office management, staff accountant and controller positions in various for-profit and non-profit organizations. Since Donna came on board as Treasurer at Green Street Studios in 2009, she has been hands-on in managing the finances of our organization. She enjoys the volunteer work, and having a background specifically in music, still shares a passion for all branches of the Arts.

<a href="#top">back to top</a>]]></content:encoded>
