	<item>
		<title>Directions</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/directions/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:02:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=53</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #000000;">Green Street Studios is located at 185 Green St., Cambridge, MA in the </span><span style="color: #000000;">heart of the Boston dance community in Central Square. </span>

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;">The <img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-505" title="GSS by Liza Voll-11" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/GSS-by-Liza-Voll-111-199x300.jpg" alt="" width="199" height="300" /></span><span style="color: #000000;">studio is easily accessible by public transportation: we are located 1 block from buses and the Red Line Central Square T stop. Parking is available in the Green Street Garage and at metered parking lots.</span>

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;">Our studios are housed in a two story brick building between Pearl St. and Brookline St. Head up the stairs to visit us &amp; our neighbors <a title="Boston Percussive Dance" href="http://www.bostonpercussivedance.com" target="_blank">Boston Percussive Dance</a>!</span>

&nbsp;

<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong><span style="color: #000000;">By Car:</span></strong></span></p>
<strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>From Boston</em></span></strong>
Cross the Massachusetts Avenue Bridge into Cambridge. Half a mile from the bridge turn left on Sidney Street (a wide street just before a fire station on the left) and immediately turn right into Green Street. Drive one block to Brookline Street. Cross Brookline Street. Green Street Studio will be the 2nd building on the right.
<em>
<strong><span style="color: #000000;">From Mass Turnpike, Brookline</span></strong></em>
Take Cambridge/Allston exit on to River Street Bridge into Cambridge, continue straight on River Street less than half a mile and make a right turn on Franklin Street. Take the 3rd left turn onto Brookline Street and the next left onto Green Street.

&nbsp;

<p style="text-align: left;"><em><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Parking</strong></span></em></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><em></em>Affordable parking is located 1 block away at the Green Street Garage (corner of Pearl St. and Green St). On-street metered parking and several metered municipal lots are available in Central Square (free after 6:00 PM and on Sundays).</p>

&nbsp;

<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong><span style="color: #000000;">By Public Transportation:</span></strong></span></p>
<strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>To Central Square</em></span></strong>
By bus take #'s 1, CT1, 47, 64, 70, 70A to Central Square, Cambridge; by subway take Red Line T to Central Square Station.

&nbsp;

<strong><span style="color: #000000;"><em>From S.E. corner of Massachusetts Ave and Prospect St. / Western Ave. / Magazine St.:</em></span></strong>

Walk S.E. one block to Pearl St. Turn Right (S.W.).

Walk one block on Pearl St. to corner of Green St. and Pearl St.

Turn Left (S.E.) . Continue down Green St. Green Street Studios will be on your left.

&nbsp;
<p style="text-align: center;"><small><iframe src="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&amp;source=s_q&amp;hl=en&amp;geocode=&amp;q=Green+Street+Studios,+Green+Street,+Cambridge,+MA&amp;aq=0&amp;sll=37.0625,-95.677068&amp;sspn=53.696917,79.013672&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;hq=Green+Street+Studios,&amp;hnear=Green+St,+Cambridge,+Middlesex,+Massachusetts&amp;ll=42.363713,-71.1024&amp;spn=0.006342,0.012853&amp;z=16&amp;output=embed" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" scrolling="no" width="600" height="400"></iframe>
<small><a style="color: #0000ff; text-align: left;" href="http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&amp;source=embed&amp;hl=en&amp;geocode=&amp;q=Green+Street+Studios,+Green+Street,+Cambridge,+MA&amp;aq=0&amp;sll=37.0625,-95.677068&amp;sspn=53.696917,79.013672&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;hq=Green+Street+Studios,&amp;hnear=Green+St,+Cambridge,+Middlesex,+Massachusetts&amp;ll=42.363713,-71.1024&amp;spn=0.006342,0.012853&amp;z=16">View Larger Map</a></small></small></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Performances &amp; Events</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/performances-events/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 Jun 2011 00:38:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=5</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a name="top"></a>
<div>
<div>

<strong>UPCOMING PERFORMANCES &amp; EVENTS<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/COURSE-OF-ACTION-BW-copy.jpg"><img class="alignright  wp-image-2135" title="COURSE-OF-ACTION-BW-copy" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/COURSE-OF-ACTION-BW-copy-662x1024.jpg" alt="" width="278" height="430" /></a></strong>

<strong><em><span style="font-size: medium;">Course of Action: New Dance Works</span></em></strong>

<strong><em></em>Presented by Green Street Studios Emerging Artists of Spring 2012</strong>

&nbsp;

Friday, June 15 and Saturday, June 16 at8 P.M.

Green Street Studios, 185 Green Street,Cambridge, MA, 02139

Tickets: $10 Reservations, BDA/GSS members or $15 At the Door

For reservations, call Green Street Studios:<a href="tel:%28617%29%20864-3191" target="_blank">(617) 864-3191</a>

This Spring, several choreographers have been hard at work creating new dances with the support of Green Street Studios Emerging Artist Award Program, a program that provides promising dance artists with rehearsal space and valuable feedback from established artist-mentors.<em>Course of Action</em>showcases the diverse dance works that have emerged during this process.

Lailye Weidman and Alli Ross will perform an energetic duet, conversing with physical rhythms and game-like improvisations. Jeff Gugliottis dance theater piece depicts a tale of desire with unique and expressive gestural flair. Kristen Duffy Young mines the qualities of patience and ease, evoking natural processes and environments with four exquisite dancers. Caitlin Ewing and Kelly Onder boldy revise and recreate an earlier collaborative work to show both the development of their choreographic sensibilities and the growth of a friendship. A short Q&amp;A with the artists will follow.

</div>
<div>Mentors for this cycle are Micki Taylor-Pinney, Heidi Henderson, and Meghan McLyman</div>
&nbsp;

<form action="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr" method="post"><input type="hidden" name="cmd" value="_s-xclick" /> <input type="hidden" name="hosted_button_id" value="74LA2BWG8HXF4" />

<tbody>

</tr>

<td><select name="os0"> <option value="Friday, June 15">Friday, June 15$10.00 USD</option> <option value="Saturday, June 16">Saturday, June 16$10.00 USD</option> </select></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<input type="hidden" name="currency_code" value="USD" /> <input type="image" name="submit" src="https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/i/btn/btn_buynowCC_LG.gif" alt="PayPal - The safer, easier way to pay online!" /> <img src="https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/i/scr/pixel.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1" border="0" /></form>___________________________________________________________

<strong>Did you miss the Gala? Save the Date for a special Gala Video Showing!<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/square-for-sharing.jpg"><img class="alignright  wp-image-2146" title="square-for-sharing" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/square-for-sharing.jpg" alt="" width="360" height="341" /></a></strong>

Sunday, June 17th at 6:30pm. Donations welcome.

&nbsp;

Video of the show on the big screen, wine and food, raffle of Gala auction items (ask your teacher or a GSS staff member for raffle tickets - info on website tba), and more! Help us make our Goal and see some amazing performances!

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

***<strong>Thank you to everyone who came out to support our 20th Anniversary Gala; a fantastic audience, crew, and group of performers all made for a sensational evening. Many thanks to all our friends who made the evening possible: the fabulous Jayne Murphy and tech crew, GSS Board and staff, Gala Coordinator Mariela Cerda, MC Nicole Pierce, Jimena Bermejo Black, Kieran Jordan &amp; Julia Boynton and all of Boston Percussive Dance, our dedicated volunteers, the GSS founders, and finally, the talented choreographers and performers whose brilliance and generosity made the show shine.***</strong>

<a title="2012 GSS Gala  May 12" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/2012-gss-gala-may-12/"><strong>Green Street Studios 20th Anniversary Gala</strong><img class="alignright" title="" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/square-for-sharing-300x284.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="284" /></a>

Saturday May 12th. 8pm.

Have you reserved your ticket yet? To make a reservation please visit the<a title="Registration" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/performances-events/2012-gala/registration/" target="_blank">Gala Registration page</a>

<strong>Performances by:</strong>

<strong></strong>David Dorfman,Sean Curran and Dancers,Lorraine Chapman The Company,Sean Fielder/Boston Tap Company,David Parker/The Bang Group,Nicole Pierce/EgoArt, Inc., Josh Hilberman, Marcus Schulkind (performed by Lindsey Ridgeway),Contrapose Dance,Gianni Di Marco and Adriana Surez

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<strong>
</strong>

<strong>
Across The Ages</strong>

<strong></strong>June 1st, 2nd, and 3rd

To make a reservation please call 617-864-3191

<img class="wp-image-1676 alignleft" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Card-Combo-759x1024.jpg" alt="" width="442" height="597" />

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

**Please see our Performance Calendar below. For tickets call 617-864-3191.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<a title="Artist Programs" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/artist-programs/" target="_blank"><strong>Emerging Artists Performance</strong></a>

June 15 &amp; 16 8pm

&nbsp;
<p align="LEFT"><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Emerging Artists Spring/Summer 2012</span></p>
<p align="LEFT">Jeffrey Gugliotti</p>
<p align="LEFT">Kristen Duffy Young</p>
<p align="LEFT">Caitlin Ewing and Kelly Onder</p>
<p align="LEFT">Lailye Weidman</p>
Mentors: Heidi Henderson, Meghan McLyman (EA Alumna), Micki Taylor-Pinni

The artists are at work! Stay tuned for info on their show

</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Archive</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a id="top" name="top"></a>

<strong>Across The Ages Dance Project</strong><img class="alignright" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Card-Combo-759x1024.jpg" alt="" width="442" height="597" />

<strong></strong>June 1st, 2nd, and 3rd

To make a reservation please call 617-864-3191

&nbsp;
***<strong>Thank you to everyone who came out to support our 20th Anniversary Gala; a fantastic audience, crew, and group of performers all made for a sensational evening. Many thanks to all our friends who made the evening possible: the fabulous Jayne Murphy and tech crew, GSS Board and staff, Gala Coordinator Mariela Cerda, MC Nicole Pierce, Jimena Bermejo Black, Kieran Jordan &amp; Julia Boynton and all of Boston Percussive Dance, our dedicated volunteers, the GSS founders, and finally, the talented choreographers and performers whose brilliance and generosity made the show shine.***</strong>
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
<a title="2012 GSS Gala  May 12" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/2012-gss-gala-may-12/"><strong>Green Street Studios 20th Anniversary Gala</strong><img class="alignright" title="" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/square-for-sharing-300x284.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="284" /></a>

Saturday May 12th, 2012. 8pm.

Have you reserved your ticket yet? To make a reservation please visit the<a title="Registration" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/performances-events/2012-gala/registration/" target="_blank">Gala Registration page</a>

<strong>Performances by:</strong>

<strong></strong>David Dorfman,Sean Curran and Dancers,Lorraine Chapman The Company,Sean Fielder/Boston Tap Company,David Parker/The Bang Group,Nicole Pierce/EgoArt, Inc., Josh Hilberman, Marcus Schulkind (performed by Lindsey Ridgeway),Contrapose Dance,Gianni Di Marco and Adriana Surez

&nbsp;

&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
<strong>Dear Olivia:April 27th and 28th, 2012</strong><a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/147.jpg"><img class="alignright" title="" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/147-300x214.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="214" /></a>

In "Dear Olivia", choreography by Joanie block, original music by Billy Novick, sets by Linda Klein, and videography by Lynn Bikofsky come together in six dances exploring the life span of a woman under the watchful and guiding eye of a young girl's spirit. The idea that the "inner girl" accompanies women through all stages of life is at the core of the production.

Tickets: $20 adult/$18 student, seniors &amp; BDA members

To make a reservation please call 617-864-3191

&nbsp;

&nbsp;
<div>
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
<strong>Philip Hamilton and Friends</strong>

<img class="alignright size-full wp-image-1703" title="" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/60571.jpg" alt="" width="133" height="200" /><strong>Saturday April 21st, 2012 - 8pm</strong>

Vocalist/Composer Philip Hamilton returns to Green Street Studios in Cambridge with his popular music and dance series entitled, An Evening with Philip Hamilton and Friends.

This time around Hamilton has invited long time collaborator pianist George W. Russell Jr., belly dancing star Samarra and innovative movers Ruth Whitney and Chien-Hwe CarolHong to join in on the fun. As always, the evening is sure to be entertaining and captivating.

The performance is on Saturday, April 21st at Green Street Studios at 185 Green St in Cambridge, Central Square at 8 pm. Tickets are $17.50 online/$20 at the door.

For more info and tickets..
http://montenegroproduction.<a href="http://ticketbud.com/" target="_blank">ti<wbr>cketbud.com/</wbr></a>ph-friends4-21
<div></div>
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
<div><strong>Khaliji Dance Workshop</strong></div>
<div><strong>Sunday March 18, 2012</strong></div>
<div>An exploration of Khaliji folk dance, thesocial dances</div>
<div>that women from Saudi Arabia and its neighboring Gulf countries</div>
<div>perform at weddings and other celebrations.This dance style has</div>
<div>expanded to the nightclub stage and disco floors</div>
<div>around the Middle East and beyond.</div>
<div></div>
<div>The class will include basic technique,asimple group choreography,</div>
<div>costuming, drumming, and learning a Khaliji song in Arabic.</div>
<div></div>
<div>Kay Hardy Campbell is a local dance teacher and choreographer</div>
<div>who has been studying and teaching Khaliji dance for three decades.</div>
<div>She learned the dances while living in Saudi Arabia.Lisa Esperson</div>
<div>is a Cape Cod performer and teacher of Middle Eastern percussion.</div>
<div></div>
<div>Date: Sunday, March 18, 2012</div>
<div>Time: 1-5 PM</div>
<div>Place: Green Street Studios, 185 Green Street, Cambridge, MA</div>
<div>Fee:$60.00 pre-registered (Paypal or check - price valid until March 17th)</div>
<div> $75.00 at the door</div>
<div>Link to flyer and Registration form:<a title="http://www.kayhardycampbell.com/workshop.htm" href="http://www.kayhardycampbell.com/workshop.htm" target="_blank">www.kayhardycampbell.com/<wbr>workshop.htm</wbr></a></div>
<div>Questions about the workshop? e-mail<a href="mailto:kaycam@aol.com" target="_blank">kaycam@aol.com</a>or call <a href="tel:617-512-8122" target="_blank">617-512-8122</a>
&nbsp;
&nbsp;
<strong>Contrapose Dance presents:</strong><strong>DOUBLE/TAKE</strong><strong>March 3/17/2012</strong><img class="alignright" title="marchrepshowpostertara-copy" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/marchrepshowpostertara-copy-235x300.jpg" alt="" width="235" height="300" />A Contrapose Dance repertory show featuring recent/new work

Join Contrapose Dance, Boston's repertory dance company, in DOUBLE/TAKE, an evening of new/recent work. Featured is the premiere of a new commission by David Parker, a solo by Bostons own Marcus Schulkind, the second showing of Sydney Skybetters Potemkin Piece, the first showing of Gianni Di Marcos Sanitas in its entirety, a premiere by Canadas Heidi Rood &amp; Courtney Peixs Ground. Ranging from light &amp; playful to dramatic, mesmerizing, &amp; intense each one-of-a kind piece is not to be missed.

Saturday, March 17<sup>th</sup>at 8:00pm

Tickets:

$20.00 general admission

$17.00 students/BDA members

<a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/230937" target="_blank">www.brownpapertickets.com/<wbr>event/230937</wbr></a>

Cash and checks accepted at the door
Reservations &amp; info:<a href="mailto:info@contraposedance.com" target="_blank">info@contraposedance.com</a> OR<a href="tel:508-631-1076" target="_blank">508-631-1076</a>

&nbsp;

Contrapose Dancers: Amy Caine, Lotsie Cash, Magdalena Gyftopolous, Jenny Lustig, Tara Mccrystal, Courtney Peix, Cecilia Raassina, Amberlee Timm, Tony Tucker, Arian Winn

Choreographers: David Parker, Marcus Schulkind, Gianni Di Marco, Sydney Skybetter, Heidi Rood, Courtney Peix

<a href="http://www.contraposedance.com/" target="_blank">www.contraposedance.com</a>

&nbsp;
<p align="LEFT"><strong>Philip Hamilton "Voices"</strong>
Feb 18, 2012 8pm<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/6057.jpg"><img class="alignright" title="6057" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/6057.jpg" alt="" width="133" height="200" /></a>
$17.50 General Admission
$50 Reception and Performance
See link for tickets and more info:</p>
<p align="LEFT"><a href="http://montenegroproduction.ticketbud.com/phandfriends2-18" target="_blank">http://montenegroproduction.ticketbud.com/phandfriends2-18</a></p>

<div>Composer/Vocalist Philip Hamilton returns to Cambridge's Green Street Studios for an exciting evening of music and dance with piano master George W Russell Jr., prolific tapper Josh Hilberman, striking modern dancer Lindsay Ridgeway, Brazilian bass whiz Segio Groove, rapper I-MC and vocalists Kevin and Barry Marshall. The evening is sure to be entertaining and uplifting.</div>
This performance is the latest installment of Hamilton's "Capital Campaign for VOICES", an ongoing fundraising drive to raise money and awareness for "VOICES", his celebrated world music acappella show. "VOICES" was a hit at theEdinburgh Festival Fringe and was named on the "Best of Festival" lists of numerous critics and media personalities. "VOICES" is currently in pre-production for their appearance at the prestigious Festival of Songs in Wroclaw, Poland in March.

The performance on Saturday, Feb 18th is at Green Street Studios at 185 Green St in Cambridge, Central Square at 8 pm. Tickets are $17.50 online/$20 at the door/ $50 show and reception.

The pre-show reception is at 7 pm on Saturday and is sponsored by "Friends of VOICES", a group committed to support Hamilton's "VOICES". Those attending the reception will receive a ticket to the show, a complimentary CD, light refreshments, beer and wine and hear Hamilton talk about "VOICES" upcoming projects. "VOICES" is member of the Boston Dance Alliance, a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization, so reception tickets are tax-exempt.

&nbsp;

<strong>Breaking Ties/Enigmatic Dance</strong>
Feb 10-11, 2012 8pm<img class="alignright" title="139" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/139-300x230.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="230" />
General admission $20
BDA/GSS discount $18

	<item>
		<title>Teachers &amp; Artists in Residence</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/teachers-artists-in-residence/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 03:56:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=23</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a id="top" name="top"></a>
Green Street Studios is home to some of Boston's most engaging and experienced movement artists and teachers. Our founding and long time artistic residents engage students on many levels, offering work in classical and innovative movement approaches to contemporary dance.


<a href="#olivier">Olivier Besson (Contact Improvisation)</a>

<a href="#tarikh">Tarikh Campbell (Hip Hop)</a>

<a href="#katie">Katie Dealy (Parent-Child Dance &amp; Creative Dance)</a>

<a href="#sarahm">Sarah Mae Gibbons (Introduction to Modern)</a>

<a href="#merli">Merli V. Guerra (Luminarium Open Class)</a>

<a href="#kim">Kimberleigh Holman (Luminarium Open Class)</a>

<a href="#chien">Chien Hwe (Contemporary Open Level)</a>

<a href="#matei">Matei Livianu (Salsa)</a>

<a href="#marta">Marta Moussa (Hawaiian Dance)</a>

<a href="#najmat">Najmat (Middle Eastern Dance/Belly Dance)</a>

<a href="#peter">Peter Petrov (Balkan Dance)</a>

<a href="#nicole">Nicole Pierce (Int/Adv Modern)</a>

<a href="#marcus">Marcus Schulkind (Int/Adv Ballet, Int/Adv Modern, &amp; Back to the Marley)</a>

<a href="#rebecca">Rebecca Rice (Int/Adv Modern)</a>

<a href="#liz">Liz Roncka (Movement Improvisation)</a>

<a href="#andy">Andy Taylor-Blenis (Int. Modern Jazz)</a>

<a href="#dean">Dean Vollick (Int. Ballet)</a><a id="olivier" name="olivier"></a>

<a href="#jody">Jody Weber (Adv. Beginning Modern &amp; Int/Adv Modern)</a>

&nbsp;

<strong><span style="font-family: Georgia, serif;"><span style="font-size: small;"><a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/206728_1072546007988_1056290048_242338_2289_n.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-2131" title="206728_1072546007988_1056290048_242338_2289_n" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/206728_1072546007988_1056290048_242338_2289_n-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a>Olivier Besson <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#improvolivier" target="_blank">(Contact Improvisation)</a></span></span></strong>

<span style="font-family: Georgia, serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Olivier Besson is an improviser, choreographer and teacher who hails from France and is based in Boston. He has studied contact improvisation with Robin Feld, Nancy Stark Smith, Lisa Nelson and Andrew Harwood.</span></span><span style="font-size: small; font-family: Georgia, serif;">Oliviers work has been presented in Japan, Russia, France, Taiwan and the US. He is currently teaching improvisation and contact improvisation at The Boston Conservatory and has been on faculty at Canal Danse (Paris), the French National Circus School, Bates Dance Festival, Emerson College and the School of Fine Arts at Boston University.</span>

<a id="tarikh" name="tarikh"></a>

<a href="#top">back to top</a>





<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft  wp-image-1745" title="Tarikh Campbell" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Tarikh-Campbell1.jpg" alt="" width="253" height="182" />Tarikh Campbell <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#hiphop" target="_blank">(Hip Hop)</a></strong></span>

Tarikh Campbell was born in New York City and raised in Teaneck, NJ. Tarikh began dancing in his freshman year at MIT where he joined the schools Dance Troupe. Throughout his college years, Tarikh focused on hip hop, jazz, and contemporary training with fellow MIT students. Only a year into his dance life, Tarikh decided to branch out from MIT and check out dance groups in the Greater Boston area, where he was introduced to teams like The Rainbow Tribe Dance Company and B Side. With time, Tarikh felt confident enough to audition for Bostons competitive hip hop scene and joined MITs Ridonkulous, which he later captained for a year. Toward the end of his college days, Tarikh and a few male hip hop dancers came together and formed Side Project, a crew that takes performance as seriously as a professional company but runs like a group of friends. After graduating from MIT, Tarikh went on to join Static Noyze, which took 1st place at Fusions Elements X, 3rd at Best of the East 2010, and 2nd at The Main Event: Round 2. Tarikhs most recent project is PROject Nailz, a small hip hop crew consisting of female dancers, led by Tarikh and his long-time friend/first mentor, Adlai Grayson. At the moment, Tarikh dances with SidePro, Static, PRONailz, MIT Dance Troupe and teaches classes at the Jeanette Neil Dance Studio, The Dance Academy Of Siagel Productions, and Green Street Studios.

<a id="katie" name="katie"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1746" title="images" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" /></a>Katie Dealy <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#childrens" target="_blank">(Creative Dance)</a></strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">Katie Dealy has taught dance and creative movement to children in the Boston/Cambridge area for many years. She holds a Masters in Education from Simmons College and a Masters in Dance Education from George Washington University. In addition to teaching for CPP, Katie also teaches at the Cambridge Performance Project and several pre-schools. Katie likes to use props and create story dances in her energetic and imaginative classes.</p>
<a href="#top">back to top</a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<a id="sarahm" name="sarahm"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft  wp-image-1747" title="Photo 9" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Photo-9-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="240" height="180" />Sarah Mae Gibbons <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#intromod" target="_blank">(Intro to Modern)</a></strong></span>
Sarah Mae Gibbons, originally from Athens, Ohio, earned her BFA in dance and minored in education at The Ohio State University. While there, she performed in works by numerous faculty members including; Bebe Miller, Ming Lung Yang and Victoria Uris as well as independent works by Annie Kloppenberg, Shawn Hove and Foreground Dance. Sarah Maes aesthetic and interests lie in reinvesting attention to the practice of improvisation as a performance form, dance as a means of education and discovering links between choreography and research. Sarah Mae currently dances for Annie Kloppenberg, Deadfall Dance, Zoe Dance, Quicksilver Dance and other independent choreographers as well as teaching at the Dance Place , "Green Street Studios" and for the Cambridge Performance Project. In addition, Sarah Maes choreography has been shown and received recognition through the Green Street Emerging Artist Program as well the Ohio Christian Dance Assembly. She is one of the founding members of P.I.E. (Performance Improvisation Ensemble) a touring compositional improvisation community. She is also working in close collaboration with Caitlin Ewing and Kelly Onder in the creation of a new Boston based choreography and programming.<a id="merli" name="merli"></a>

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="size-full wp-image-1746 alignleft" title="" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" />MerliV. Guerra <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#luminarium" target="_blank">(Luminarium Open Class)</a></strong></span>

<span style="color: #000000;">Merli V. Guerra is a professional dancer and interdisciplinary artist with a background in ballet, modern, and classical Odissi technique. She holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Dance and Studio Art from Mount Holyoke College, and is Artistic Director of Luminarium Dance Company in Cambridge. Guerra is also a member of Nataraj Dancers (Amherst), a classical Indian dance company with whom she studied in India in 2007 and performed in Japan in 2009. After co-founding Luminarium in 2010, Guerra was invited to speak on a panel at Mount Holyoke College about succeeding in the arts professionally after graduation, and later received an honorarium for Luminarium to present new work at her alma mater. In 2011, she began performing with Deborah Abel Dance Company (Boston), and will join the company for its India tour in 2012. Outside of dance, Guerra is an award-winning artistic filmmaker. Her films, art installations, and choreographic works have been selected for venues across New England, among them the Rhodywood Filmmakers Showcase, Boston Center for the Arts, Seacoast Fringe Festival, Mobius Alternative Arts Space, and Jennifer Muller/The Works in NYC. As a teacher, Guerra combines the drive and fluidity of contemporary dance with the intricacies of Eastern hand gestures. Herinterests lie in the layering of video projection with live performance, and in setting the visual arts into motion. P</span><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">lease visit</span><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a href="http://www.merliguerra.com/" target="_blank"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">www.merliguerra.com</span></a></span><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">.</span><a id="kim" name="kim"></a>

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

<strong><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1746" title="" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" />Kimberleigh Holman <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#luminarium" target="_blank">(Luminarium Open Class)</a></strong>

<strong></strong>Kimberleigh Holman is the co-founder/artistic director of Luminarium Dance Company. She graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Dance from Mount Holyoke College, having also studied lighting design. Outside of her formal education, Holman has pursued training with Luigi Faccuito and through intensives with the Mark Morris Dance Group. Since Luminarium's establishment in 2010, Holman has been invited to show work at the Boston Center for the Arts, Mobius, the Seacoast Fringe Festival, Mount Holyoke College, at many other festivals and in self-produced concerts. In 2010 she received the President's Innovation Fund from the Boys and Girls Clubs of Boston to create the Performing Arts Program, which culminated in LEAP: Leading and Engaging Artistic Pursuits. The program gave underserved Chelsea youth the chance to gain experience and insight into the professional performing arts. Holman has taught or choreographed work at Berkshire Hills Music Academy, Wellesley High School, the Boys and Girls Clubs of Boston, Babson College, and in Brookline public school's Theatre Arts Program. She looks forward to <a id="chien" name="chein"></a>sharing her style of movement with dancers at Green Street Studios.

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

<strong><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1754" title="5532_147521900700_727330700_4033873_5760303_n" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/5532_147521900700_727330700_4033873_5760303_n-200x300.jpg" alt="" width="200" height="300" />Chien Hwe<a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#contemp" target="_blank">(Contemporary Open Level)</a></strong>
Chien-Hwe began ballet classes at the age of 7 under the direction of Irene Merrill and performed for 6 years in the Mid-Cape Ballet's Nutcracker. She attended The Ailey School's Summer Intensive program for 2 consecutive years, training under Denise Vale, a former principal dancer for the Martha Graham Dance Company. Soon after, she was accepted in the Ailey/Fordham B.F.A. program where she was invited to perform with the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater as a student guest dancer for 3 consecutive years during their City Center Season. Chien-Hwe was also a soloist in the AFSD (Ailey/Fordham Student Dancers) where she had the opportunity to perform works byAlvin Ailey,Steve Rooks, Milton Myers, Celia Marino, Nathan Trice, Kevin Wynn, Paul Taylor, Francesca Harper and Ronald K. Brown/Evidence. Other studies and training include Bates Dance Festival, Merce Cunningham School on scholarship and Alonzo King/LINES Ballet Professional Workshop. Chien-Hwe has taught at schools and studios in Cape Cod, Cambridge and Hong Kong, has choreographed plays and musicals for drama productions in Los Angeles and Hong Kong. She made top 100 of So You Think You Can Dance 2009 Boston, most recently produced, performed and choreographed in a Shared Choreographers' Concert at The Dance Complex and received the Green Street Studios Emerging Artist Award 2012. She is a co-founder and choreographer for Cambridge Choreographers' Collaborative and also the founder and artistic director for 1,000 Virtues Dance Ensemble. Chien-Hwe is on a mission to change the world with dance.

&nbsp;

<a id="matei" name="matei"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1748" title="matei" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/matei-200x300.jpg" alt="" width="200" height="300" />Matei Livianu <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#salsa" target="_blank">(Salsa)</a></strong></span>
Matei started dancing ballroom in 2000 in Los Angeles with the Clarement Colleges Ballroom Dance Company. Competing in International Latin events around the country, he and his partner won the Collegiate Open Paso Doble Championship, and with the tour team, the Collegiate Formation Team Championship in 2003. Inspired by the salsa scene, he spent many evenings learning and dancing in the Los Angeles area clubs. Since 2004, he has been teaching salsa, cha-cha, bachata, and merengue, starting in Los Angeles, then Atlanta, and now Boston. In 2006, he co-founded the Salsa Club at Georgia Tech and, together with a stellar group of dedicated volunteers, built a thriving campus organization, complete with weekly classes, salsa socials with live music, and a performance group, for which he helped choreograph a 6-couple salsa routine. Over the years, he has taught many new dancers not only dance steps, but to move with rhythm and style that grabs attention on the dance floor. Matei's genuine interest in the improvement of his students' skills has contributed greatly the evolution of his own skills as a dancer, performer, and teacher. For more information visit <a href="http://www.salsamatei.com/" target="_blank">www.salsamatei.com</a>
<a id="marta" name="marta"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<strong><span style="color: #000000;"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1746" title="images" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" />Marta Moussa <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#hawaiian" target="_blank">(Hawaiian)</a></span></strong>

Marta Moussa has over 30 years of experience in ethnic dance as a performer, teacher, and choreographer. She co-founded and directed the International Academy of Ethnic Dance (the only dance studio in New England to offer Hula and Tahitian dance) and was co-artistic director of Anjali Ethnic Dance Company. In 1985, Marta founded Polynesian Dance Arts. She continues to direct the professional performance group and teach PDA's Polynesian dance classes. Marta first studied hula with ethnic dance great, La Meri. Marta subsequently studied hula with the late Kumu Hula Rose Kapulani Joshua and her daughter Lorraine of Honolulu, Hawai'i. Marta continues her study of hula with Kumu Hula Keith Awai. Marta was a guest performer for Ethnic Dance Arts under the direction of La Meri. Marta has performed with Polynesian Dance Arts, Ethnic Dance Arts, and Anjali Ethnic Dance Co. to name just a few. Marta was a dance major at Boston Conservatory of Music and a Theater Education major at Emerson College.

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

<a id="najmat" name="najmat"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1746" title="images" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" />Najmat <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#belly" target="_blank">(Middle Eastern/Belly Dance)</a></strong></span>
Najmat is a Brazilian-born, Boston-based dancer. She is widely known for her strong and compelling performances and expert drum solos. As a teacher, Najmat sees the therapeutic side of middle eastern dance -- it is a healing dance designed to awaken the feminine spirit and unleash women's sensuality and inner power.
<a id="peter" name="peter"></a>

&nbsp;











<strong><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1746" title="images" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" />Peter Petrov <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#balkan" target="_blank">(Balkan Dance)</a></strong>

Peter received his Master's Degree in Movement and Dance from The Academy of Music, Dance and Fine Arts, Plovdiv, Bulgaria and his massage certification from The Muscular Therapy Institute/Cortiva Institute, Boston MA. As a professional dancer throughout high school and college, Peter became interested in injury prevention and alternative medicine after suffering two serious leg and hip injuries.

Peter's fitness and muscular therapy experience includes 5 years with WAVE Health &amp; Fitness, where he worked as an assistant manager, massage therapist, and personal trainer. He implemented exercise programs for his clients and taught various fitness classes such as Total Body Conditioning, Full Body Stretch, Spinning, Yoga and Body Pump. In his 5 years as a chiropractic assistant, Peter developed stretching and strengthening programs for patients with acute and chronic pain issues. In his spare time Peter teaches dance and directs his own dance company.

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

<a name="nicole"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft  wp-image-1749" title="nicole_pierce" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/nicole_pierce-240x300.jpg" alt="" width="216" height="270" />Nicole Pierce <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#modnicole" target="_blank">(Int/Adv Modern)</a></strong></span>
Nicole Pierce is the Artistic Director of <a href="http://www.egoartinc.com/" target="_blank">EgoArt, Inc.</a><a name="nicole"></a> which she founded in 1999 to pursue self-discovery, universal truth and cultural paradoxes through dance, theater, music and multimedia. She serves on the dance faculty at Emerson College and Green Street Studios where she also served as the Co-Executive Director from 2000 to 2005. Pierce teaches music with her own private practice in the Boston area. She has taught master classes in dance technique at Harvard University, Tufts University, Emerson College, Salem State College and the Chelmsford Academy of Ballet Arts. Pierce has danced locally for Marcus Schulkind, Caitlin Corbett and Jody Weber among others.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<a name="marcus"></a>

<a href="#top">back to top</a>





<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft  wp-image-1750" title="LizaVollPhotography-6822" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/LizaVollPhotography-6822-300x199.jpg" alt="" width="243" height="161" />Marcus Schulkind <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#modmarcus" target="_blank">(Int/Adv Ballet &amp; Int/Adv Modern)</a></strong></span>
Marcus Schulkind is a founding director of Green Street Studios and has been dancing, teaching, and performing for over thirty-three years. Originally trained in Graham Technique and Graham based variants (Norman Walker, May ODonnell, Pearl Lang), he went on to study ballet with Antony Tudor and Maggie Black at Julliard, bodywork with Zena Rommett (for whom he taught in New York), and Pilates Technique with Kathy Grant. He has performed nationally and internationally with many major modern dance companies including Lar Lubovitch, Kathy Posin, and Batsheva Dance Company of Isreal. He has taught in the United States, Europe, Canada, and the Middle East. Mr. Schulkind is a nationally recognized dancer, teacher, and choreographer, having received grants from the N.E.A., N.Y.S.C.A., Affiliate Artists Inc., Bank Boston Celebrity Series, and First Night. He has choreographed for Dennis Waynes Company, Princeton Ballet, David Brown, Elisa Monte, 5 by 2 Plus, People Dancing, Pick of the Crop, Little Feet, Peanut Butter and Jelly Dance Company, and in Canada for Dance Partout and the National Ballet of Egypt. Since seriously injuring his knee twelve years ago, he has been integrating physical therapies and his five year training of Pilates into his floor barre, modern, and ballet technique classes. Marcus is also a <a href="http://www.marcusschulkind.org/" target="_blank">practicing acupuncturist</a>.

<a name="rebecca"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft  wp-image-1751" title="Rebecca Rice Photo" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Rebecca-Rice-Photo-300x184.jpg" alt="" width="240" height="147" />Rebecca Rice <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#modrebecca" target="_blank">(Int/Adv Modern)</a></strong></span>
Rebecca Rice is an award winning choreographer and respected teacher in the Boston community. She taught modern dance and creative process at the Boston Ballet for almost 20 years and created numerous works on BBII as well as organized Boston Ballet's first choreography workshops, "Studio 7 @ Boston Ballet.". She developed modern and choreography programs at MIT, Winsor and the Dana Hall School and was artist-in-residence at Green Street Studios during the summer of 2007. Her company, Rebecca Rice Dance, has been presented in MA by various organizations including Boston Ballet, Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival, Bank of America Celebrity Series, The Boston Pops, World Music and CMAC and made its New York City debut in 2006. Rebecca graduated with honors in modern dance performance from the University of Utah where she studied and worked with Bill Evans, Ron Ruby, Ririe-Woodbury and the Utah Repertory Dance Theatre. In New York City she worked with Viola Farber as well as studied at the Limon and Ailey Schools.She was a graduate teaching fellow at the University of Pittsburgh where she was a founding member of the Pittsburgh Dance Alloy Company where she performed and choreographed for six years. She performed with various artists and companies throughout the United States including Pittsburgh Dance Alloy, Gerri Houlihan, Stephen Pelton, Bill Evans and Marianne Goldberg as well as participated in choreography workshops at Jacob's Pillow with Bessie Schonberg. Coming from a small town in Massachusetts, she grew up studying and performing the work of Ted Shawn and Ruth St. Denis with her grandmother, Marion Rice. <a href="http://www.rebeccaricedance.com/">rebeccaricedance.com</a><a name="nicole"></a>. For more information on classes with Rebecca Rice, please contact <a href="mailto:riceflan@gmail.com">riceflan@gmail.com</a><a name="nicole"></a>.<a id="liz" name="liz"></a>
<strong><span style="color: #000000;">
<strong></strong>
<a href="#top">back to top</a>
</span></strong>

<strong><span style="color: #000000;"><a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_2988-.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-1752" title="IMG_2988" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/IMG_2988--225x300.jpg" alt="" width="225" height="300" /></a>Liz Roncka <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#improvliz" target="_blank">(Movement Improvisation)</a></span></strong>

Liz Roncka is an avid practitioner and teacher of movement improvisation and contemporary dance. She has taught improvisation locally at Green Street Studios, Boston College, Bridgewater State College as well as in Paris at CANAL DANSE. Ms. Roncka is the director of lizroncka/Real-Time Performance Project, a founding member of the international improvisational collaborative Sounds and Signs, a collaborating artist with Emma Jupe, a Paris-based improvisation collective and a Mobius Artists Group member. Her work has been presented in Boston, NYC, San Francisco, Budapest and Paris. Liz has studied improvisation with Chris Aiken, Andrew Harwood, Julyen Hamilton, Jennifer Monson, Kirstie Simson, and Debra Bluth among others. Liz has had the pleasure of performing modern dance and improvisational work under the direction of: Ramelle Adams, Emily Beattie, Ruth Benson-Levin, Debra Bluth, Alissa Cardone, Sean Curran, Sara June, Andrew Harwood, Michael Jahoda/White Box Project, Dawn Kramer, Light Motion, Karen Murphy-Fitch and Micki Taylor-Pinney. Ms. Roncka was a company member of the Dance Collective of Boston from 1998-2005 and the Falling Flight Project from 2007-2009. Liz is also a licensed physical therapist and the owner of Axis Pilates, LLC in Brookline.

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

<a id="andy" name="andy"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1746" title="images" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" />Andy Taylor-Blenis <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#modjazz" target="_blank">(Int. Modern Jazz)</a></strong></span>
Andy started dancing with her parents in International Folk Dance at age 0. Her early Creative Movement experiences were with Ruth Wheeler, co-founder of Dance Collective, and with Ann Brown-Allen. After receiving her BFA in Dance from the University of Massachusetts at Amherst, she came to Boston and danced with Danny Sloane Dance, Paradigm Dance, Concert Dance Company, Dance Collective, Micki Taylor-Pinney, Dawn Kramer, Miguel Lopez, Milton Myers, Julie Ince-Thompson, ACE Entertainment, and has been with Prometheus Dance Company for 19 years.

She has taught International Dance through the Folk Arts Center of New England, Modern and Jazz Dance at Northwestern and Northeastern Universities, Harvard, Emerson, Boston University, Boston Conservatory and the Jeannette Neill Dance Studio. Andy is the artistic director of Mladost Dance Ensamble and the RSCDS Demonstration Team and loves teaching school residencies thru Mass Movement and Revels Inc. Andy is an adoring admirer of Lynn Simonson. Dance is a musical, satisfying, overwhelming, strengthening, challenging, freeing discipline that applies to and enhances each day of our lives. Enjoy!

<a id="dean" name="dean"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-1746" title="images" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/images.jpg" alt="" width="213" height="236" />Dean Vollick <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#balletdean" target="_blank">(Int/Adv Ballet)</a></strong></span>
Dean Vollick began his ballet training at the late age of twenty, already a college student in Brock University, St. Catharines, Ontario, Canada. It became obvious that with good professional training, he could make up for lost time. A move to Toronto led him to many fine Canadian teachers including Lois Smith, Glen Gilmour, Luc Amyot, and Mavis Staines, the Artistic Director of Canadas National Ballet School. He also had the good fortune to be under the tutelage of Laura Alonso (daughter of Alicia Alonso) for 3 summers at the Banff School of Fine Arts. His career as a classical dancer spanned several years and included work with Ontario Ballet Theatre, Ballet Omaha, and Ballet Florida. Though he loved the classics, he found that contemporary dance was his forte, and decided to pursue studies in modern dance. He acquired a thorough training in Graham based technique while working with Toronto Dance Theatre. It was there that he also began to explore his desire to choreograph, and has created works for various venues from liturgical celebrations, to sales demonstrations for the Swarovski Crystal Company. As a company dancer and freelance artist Mr. Vollick danced across Canada and many parts of the US and Europe.

A desire to teach led him back to the National Ballet School where he completed the two- year teacher-training course for professional dancers, and graduated valedictorian of his class in June of 2001. That summer he joined the faculty of the American Academy of Ballet and continues to be an instructor at their Summer School of Excellence, held at SUNY College in Purchase New York. He spent four years as a full time teacher at Boston Ballet and was Principal of Boston Ballets ground breaking Citydance outreach program for three of those years. Currently Mr. Vollick is working as a freelance teacher and choreographer in the Boston Area, and is on the faculty of Ballet Arts Worcester, Walnut Hill Academy, and Boston Conservatory. He is a certified Gryrotonic instructor, and is enjoying working as a trainer with dancers and non-dancers alike. Dean has also trained with Paul Horvath in theraputic applications with Gyrotonic.

<a href="#top">back to top</a>

<a id="jody" name="jody"></a>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><img class="alignleft  wp-image-1753" title="JodyWeberheadshot" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/JodyWeberheadshot-225x300.jpg" alt="" width="203" height="270" />Jody Weber <a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/class-descriptions/#advbegmod" target="_blank">(Adv. Beginning Modern &amp; Int/Adv Modern)</a></strong></span>
Dr. Jody Weber received a BFA from SUNY Purchase in 1988, an M.A. from American University in 1992, and a Ph.D. in dance history from Boston University in 2005. Her choreography has been presented through numerous local outlets as well as venues in New York City, Maine, Washington D.C., Central Florida and Alaska. In the 2001, 2005, and 2009 seasons, DR. Weber received an Artist Fellowship Grant from the Somerville Arts Council to support her choreography. She has also been the recipient of a choreographic fellowship for a two residencies at the Workspace for Choreographers in Virginia. From 2000-2005, she worked as Co-Executive Director of Green Street Studios Center for Movement and Dance where she continues to teach technique classes. Dr. Weber has worked as part time faculty at Stonehill College, Bates College, Emerson College, Salem State College and The College of the Holy Cross. Currently, she is Associate Professor of Dance at Bridgewater State College. Dr. Webers historical research has been presented through the Dance History Scholars Conference held at the New York Public Library in 1993 and through the Hall of Black Achievement at Bridgewater State College in 1999. Her first book, The Evolution of Aesthetic and Expressive Dance in Boston, was published in 2009 by Cambria Press.

&nbsp;

<a href="#top">back to top</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Rent Space</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/rentals/rent-space/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 03:58:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=32</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">
</span></strong><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">REHEARSALS</span></strong>
<strong>****Starting March 1st 2012 all rehearsal rentals Monday-Friday before 5pm will be $9/hr for studio 2 and $10/hr for studio 1</strong>****

&nbsp;

<strong>Studio #1</strong>- $15.00/hour

<strong>Studio #2</strong>- $12.50/hour

&nbsp;

Artist Members receive discounted Rehearsal Rates;Monday-Friday 9am-5pm

<strong>Studio #1</strong>- $9.50/hour
<strong>Studio #2</strong>- $8.50/hour

&nbsp;

To rent rehearsal space email<a href="mailto:scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org</a>

CancellationPolicy: One Week

<strong></strong>

<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">CLASSES/WORKSHOPS</span></strong><strong></strong>

<strong>Studio #1</strong>- $36.50/hour

<strong>Studio #2- </strong>$32.50/hour

To inquire about class/workshop rentals email<a href="mailto:scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org</a>

CancellationPolicy: One Week

&nbsp;

<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">OTHER RENTAL (AUDITIONS/PHOTOSHOOTS/NON-DANCE...ETC)</span></strong>

<strong>Studio #1</strong> - $25/hour

<strong>Studio #2</strong> - $22.50/hour

CancellationPolicy: One Week

&nbsp;

<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">CONCERTS &amp; PERFORMANCES</span></strong>

Capacity: 125 seats + additional 25 on the floor on mats

Two Nights (Friday/Saturday): $1100; Includes Tech Director/Lighting Designer &amp; Lights/Sound plus:
<ul>
	<li>Use of house lighting and sound system</li>
	<li>Reservations Service</li>
	<li>Dress Rehearsal &amp; 4 hours of Tech Rehearsal</li>
	<li>Use of our House Technical Director</li>
</ul>
One Night (Friday or Saturday): $725;Includes Tech Director/Lighting Designer&amp; Lights/Sound plus:
<ul>
	<li>Use of house lighting and sound system</li>
	<li>Reservations Service</li>
	<li>Dress Rehearsal &amp; 4 hours of Tech Rehearsal</li>
	<li>Use of our House Technical Director</li>
</ul>
<div>

CONCERT CANCELLATION POLICY: One Monthinitial 25% deposit upon signing contract is non-refundable.
<div>To rent performance space email<a href="mailto:scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org</a></div>
<div>

<strong>Additional Tech Time</strong>: $10/hour

<strong>Mailing List Use</strong>(Green Street Studios Events Only)
<ul>
	<li>$50 GSS Members (Once per year) through the mailhouse</li>
	<li>$75 through the mailhouse</li>
</ul>
<div>To rent performance space email<a href="mailto:scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org</a></div>
</div>
</div>
&nbsp;

<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Informal Showings</span></strong>: $200 for 2 hours
To rent space for an Informal Showing email<a href="mailto:scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org</a>

[caption id="attachment_1729" align="aligncenter" width="717" caption="Studio #1                                                                                                          Photo by Liza Voll Photography"]<img class=" wp-image-1729 " title="Studio1_Panorama2 Liza Voll" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Studio1_Panorama2-Liza-Voll-1024x315.jpg" alt="" width="717" height="221" />[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1730" align="aligncenter" width="717" caption="Studio #2                                                                                                              Photo by Liza Voll Photography"]<img class=" wp-image-1730" title="Studio2_Panorama Liza Voll" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Studio2_Panorama-Liza-Voll-1024x272.jpg" alt="" width="717" height="190" />[/caption]

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Apply</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=1227</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 Feb 2012 23:33:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>greenstreetstudios</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/?page_id=1227</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p align="LEFT"><span style="font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Bitstream Charter', Times, serif;"><span style="font-size: small;"><strong>Green Street Studios</strong> announces the Summer 2012 cycle of its <strong>Emerging Artists Award Program</strong>. </span></span></p>
<strong>Mentors for the Summer 2012 session are Heidi Henderson, Meghan McLyman (EA Alumni), and MickiTaylor-Pinney. See Bios below.</strong>

&nbsp;

<em>Emerging Artist Application Deadline<strong>EXTENDED</strong>!</em>

Applications are now due<strong>Monday, March 5th by 5pm</strong>.
<p align="LEFT"><span style="font-size: x-small;">
</span></p>
<p align="LEFT"><span style="font-size: xx-small;"><a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/02/Emerging-Artists-Application-Summer-20124.pdf">EA Application PDF</a></span></p>
&nbsp;
<p align="LEFT"><span style="font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Bitstream Charter', Times, serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">This program is designed to provide infrastructure for choreographers, to create new work, and to provide deep, ongoing mentorship between experienced and early-to-mid-career choreographers. The Emerging Artist Award provides the opportunity for New England-based choreographers to be in residence at Green Street Studios from March to June 2012. Green Street Studios will provide choreographers with Mentor/Choreographers, and will provide 40 hours of rehearsal space per awardee for the creation of new work. The new works by the awardees will premiere in a fully produced, shared concert at Green Street Studios on June 15<sup>th</sup> &amp; 16<sup>th</sup> 2012 at 8pm (dress rehearsal June 14<sup>th</sup> at 8pm).</span></span></p>
&nbsp;
<p align="LEFT"><strong>Mentors for the Summer 2012 session:</strong></p>
<strong>Heidi Henderson</strong>, choreographer for elephant JANE dance, a pick up company in RI, is a three time recipient of the RhodeIsland State Council on the Arts Choreography Fellowship. Heidi has danced in the companies of Bebe Miller, Nina Wiener,Peter Schmitz, Sondra Loring, and Paula Josa-Jones. Heidi is a contributing editor at Contact Quarterly, a vehicle for movingideas. Heidi received her BA from Colby College and her MFA from Smith College and is in her ninth year on the faculty atConnecticut College. She has been teaching at the Bates Dance Festival for many years.elephant JANE dance hasperformed at the South Bank Centre in London, in New York City, at Jacobs Pillow Inside/Out Festival, at The InternationalFestival of Dance in Taegu, Korea, at the Bates Dance Festival and at many venues in New England. Most recently elephantJANE dance premiere Pine,a trio, at the Flynn Space in Burlington, VT.

&nbsp;

<strong>Meghan McLyman</strong> is a dance professor at Salem State University in Salem, MA. She graduated with a BA in dance fromPoint Park University and received an MA in dance and arts management from American University. Recently, she continuedher studies in the Hollins University MFA program in partnership with the American Dance Festival. Meghan has taughtcourses at various dance programs including The Colleges of the Fenway, The College of the Holy Cross, James MadisonUniversity, North Quincy High School, Green Street Studios, and Avery Ballet. She has held master classes at the AmericanDance Festival, the American College Dance Festival, Tufts University, MIT, and the Massachusetts Association for Health,Physical Education, Recreation and Dance. Her choreography has been presented in Boston, Washington, DC, Pittsburgh,and throughout Virginia. Her work has received recognition in Crash Arts/World Musics Tens The Limit concert, fromGreen Street Studios Emerging Artist and Space Grant programs, from the Someville Arts Councils Somerville Struts andArt Beat Festival supported by the Massachusetts Cultural Council, at Concord Academys Summer Stages and at theAmerican Dance Festival in NC. She has performed with The Caitlin Corbett Dance Company, The Falling Flight Project,Digby Dance, The Moving Laboratory, Flip Side Dance Theatre, Sisters Trousers, and with The Avery Ballet.Meghan is an alumna of Green Street Studios' Emerging Artists Program.
<p style="text-align: left;"><strong>Micki Taylor-Pinney</strong>has directed Boston Universitys dance program since 1985.She has served as faculty advisor to the student dance company, Dance Theatre Group,faculty advisor for the dance minor program in the College of Fine Arts since 1999and director of Reach, a summer outreach program for urban youth since 1998. Sheteaches courses in modern dance, dance history, composition and aesthetics, as well as,Ideokinesis and pedagogy as a guest lecturer in the School of Education. A performer withDance Collective beginning in 1986, she became an artistic director from 1998 to 2006during which time she performed and choreographed for the company and directed theeducational/outreach programs. She has choreographed over 50 dances for BUs DanceTheatre Group and over 30 dances for professional dancers and companies. She hasserved as a dance education consultant and taught residencies for schools and collegesin Vermont, Rhode Island and Massachusetts. She is director of Mass Movement, Inc.providing educational outreach in schools and after-school programs through YoungAudiences. She co-directed a teacher training grant in the Boston Public Schools and co-authored a manual for teachers. Micki was president of Boston Dance Alliance for twoof the eight years she served on the board. Her earliest training was in international folkdancing. She has a BS from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst and an MFA fromthe University of North Carolina, Greensboro.</p>
&nbsp;
<p align="LEFT"><strong>DEADLINE EXTENDED! Applications due by Monday, March 5thby 5:00pm</strong></p>
<p align="LEFT"><a href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/02/Emerging-Artists-Application-Summer-20123.pdf">Click here for application pdf</a></p>
<p style="text-align: left;" align="LEFT"><span style="font-family: 'Franklin Gothic Medium', sans-serif;"><span style="font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Bitstream Charter', Times, serif;"><span style="font-size: small;">Questions? Email <a href="mailto:info@greenstreetstudios.org">info@greenstreetstudios.org</a></span></span></span></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Contact Us</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/contact-us/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:02:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=55</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Street Address:</strong></span>
Green Street Studios
185 Green St
Cambridge, MA 02139
USA

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Email:</strong></span>
General information: <a href="mailto:info@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">info@greenstreetstudios.org</a>
Renting information: <a href="mailto:scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org" target="_blank">scheduling@greenstreetstudios.org</a>

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Telephone:</strong></span>
1 (617) 864-3191

&nbsp;

<strong>Boston Percussive Dance:</strong>
Boston Percussive Dance is an independent studio founded by tap dancer Julia Boynton and Irish step dancer Kieran Jordan, based in Studio #3 at Green Street. For information on Boston Percussive classes, performances or festivals, check out their website at <a href="http://www.bostonpercussivedance.com" target="_blank">www.bostonpercussivedance.com</a>

&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Keep in Touch!</strong></span>
<a href="http://twitter.com/#!/GreenStDance"><img class="alignnone" src="https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-iEbUyyAoK8M/TiS0QoV1nOI/AAAAAAAAAB4/jdaVImyV4Rg/Twitter_Button.jpg" alt="" width="59" height="20" /></a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Green-Street-Studios/8575990535"><img class="alignnone" src="https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-sqQAg-ux6Qk/TiS0ShlzcXI/AAAAAAAAAB8/L5or3utuP8k/s912/Find-us-on-facebook_logo.gif" alt="" height="20" /></a><a href="http://visitor.r20.constantcontact.com/d.jsp?llr=a9u6u8bab&amp;p=oi&amp;m=1101513282368"><img class="alignnone" src="https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-Mk9Fg8oLhHc/TjsRp_-7-jI/AAAAAAAAAD0/FESREio7VBA/Mailing.png" alt="" height="20" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>55</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-06-08 00:02:53</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-06-08 04:02:53</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>closed</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>contact-us</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>47</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>4</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>page</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_page_template</wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_page_template</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Mission &amp; Vision</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/mission-vision/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:03:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=57</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: left;"><strong>Green Street Studios is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization

&nbsp;

</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><strong><em>Mission</em></strong></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">Green Street Studios is a center for movement and dance that provides a place for artists, students, and audiences to explore the boundless potential of physical movement and the expressiveness of the human body. Through its support of both established and emerging professionals, Green Street Studios provides students of all levels, and the wider public, the opportunity to be connected to and with the traditions, techniques, and language of dance.
<em></em></p>

&nbsp;

<p style="text-align: left;"><strong><em>Vision</em></strong></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">Green Street Studios is a dance and movement arts center that serves all ages and skill levels. We will be recognized for our artistic integrity, the quality of our dance education and our progressive programming. GSS will strive to identify and fill voids in the dance and movement community that are in harmony with our mission. The best professionals will be working for GSS. They will be experienced, dedicated to continually improving their teaching technique, recognized by the dance and movement community for their work, and committed to fostering and developing the Green Street Studios community.</p>
&nbsp;
<p style="text-align: left;">As a center for developing emerging dance and movement artists, GSS will provide an environment where they can experiment, take artistic risks, perform and grow. GSS will collaborate with the Boston dance community and will bring artists, dancers and Bostons audiences together to share the best and most challenging ideas, practices and practitioners by providing master classes and workshops with guest artists, offering artist residencies, and presenting performances of current and evolving trends.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>57</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-06-08 00:03:09</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-06-08 04:03:09</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>closed</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>mission-vision</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>47</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>1</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>page</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_wp_page_template</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>History</title>
		<link>http://greenstreetstudios.org/about-us/history/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2011 04:04:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jonathan</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://greenstreetstudios.org/wordpress/?page_id=59</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_203" align="alignright" width="309" caption="Photo by Ellen Feldman"]<a href="http://ellenfeldman.net" target="_blank"><img class="size-medium wp-image-203 " title="flying hair" src="http://greenstreetstudios.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/flying-hair1-177x300.jpg" alt="" width="309" height="513" /></a>[/caption]

Green Street Studios (GSS) is a laboratory for dance in the Boston area. Founded in 1991 by five artists as a workspace, GSS now supports the performing, rehearsing and teaching needs of a diverse group of individuals and companies. With two studios and 125-seat black box studio/theatre, GSS is a purpose-built dance facility in a dynamic urban setting, one that offers dancers what they need to be successful.

&nbsp;

The Studio has grown from a cooperatively-run space to a dance and movement arts center managed by an active board of Trustees, a professional staff and volunteers committed to providing affordable facilities for training, rehearsals, and performances. GSS is now home to hundreds of dancers who rehearse and study, and over 20 teachers in a range of disciplines.

&nbsp;

Green Street Studios is the home of <a title="Boston Percussive Dance" href="http://greenstreetstudios.org/classes-2/boston-percussive-dance/" target="_blank">Boston Percussive Dance.</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>closed</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name>history</wp:post_name>
